loans.name: Evelin Piedad

texts.es:
EVELIN PIEDAD tiene 22 años de edad es madre soltera tiene un hijo de dos años de edad, vive con el hijo y los padres en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

EVELIN PIEDAD se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama y caballero. Solicita el créeito para comprar mercadería, pantalones, calentadores, sueteres, camisetas. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar la mercadería para vender a los clientes. Los desafíos a los que se nefrenta es la competencia. 

El sueño es seguir cumpliendo con el negocio. En elt iempo libre le gusta reunirce con la familia.
texts.en:
Evelin Piedad is 22 years old and a single mother of a two-year-old son. She and her son live with her parents in Chimbo, Bolívar Province.

Evelin Piedad sells clothing for women and men. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy merchandise, trousers, leg warmers, sweaters, and T-shirts. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy goods to sell to her customers. The challenges she faces include dealing with the competition.

Her goal is to continue operating her business. In her free time, she enjoys getting together with her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, trousers, leg warmers, sweaters, and T-shirts.

loans.name: Dúo Resusitado Group

texts.es: Duo Resucitado,  integrado por Cruz quien se dedica al cultivo de ejote, arveja, suchini, espinaca, tiene cultivado en diferentes lugares para cosechar cada cinco días y no estar sin trabajo y sin ingresos, Doña Cruz ya tiene 20 años en el negocio y saber todos los movimientos, entrega sus productos a una cooperativa ubicada en Santiago, siempre le ayudan sus dos hijos menores y que aun estudian, su esposo es seguridad de una empresa, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas y abono para su cultivo.
texts.en:
Cruz is a member of the group Duo Resucitado.  She makes a living in growing green beans, peas, zucchini, and spinach.  She has crops in different places in order to harvest every five days and to not be without work or without an income.

Cruz has already been working in this business for twenty years and knows about all the tasks.  She delivers her products to a cooperative located in Santiago.  Her young children always help her and they are still studying in school.  Her husband is a security guard at a company.  

She is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and manure for her crop.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure for her crop.

loans.name: Almagro

texts.es: El señor Almagro tiene 46 años de edad, casado tiene dos hijos, es licenciado en administración de empresas, actualmente no está trabajando debido a la alta tasa de desempleo en el país,  pero continua preparándose estudiando un postgrado con especialidad en procesal civil, su familia le ayuda a pagar sus estudios superiores, para don Almagro la educación es muy importante ya que dignifica al ser humano y da los beneficios económicos para el mismo y su familia, el solicita apoyo de crédito para poder pagar el curso de postgrado para culminar sus estudios.
texts.en: Almagro, 46, is married and has two children.  He has a Business Administration degree but is currently unemployed due to the high unemployment rate in the country.  However, he continues to prepare himself taking post-graduate courses in civil process.  His family helps him pay for his higher education.  For Almagro education is very important and dignifies human beings and provides economic benefits for oneself and one’s family.  He’s asking for a loan’s support to be able to pay for his post-graduate course and complete his studies.

loans.use: to pay for post-graduate courses.

loans.name: Maemge

texts.en: Maemge is 44 years old and married with 4 children between the ages of 3 and 28 that are in school. All of them lives in West Point; one of the most populated and well known market in Montserrado County. This area is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market.  She stopped attending school at the 9th grade. She has been selling palm oil, rice, charcoal, beans, okra, pepper and other items in the local market for the past ten years. She uses a motor bike to get her goods to the wholesale center. The problem she faces is the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to increase her sales (palm oil, rice, charcoal, beans, okra, pepper, etc).  Her dream is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to increase her sales (palm oil, rice, charcoal, beans, okra, pepper, etc)

loans.name: Vilma Cordelia

texts.es: Vilma Cordelia a sus 41 años de edad, casada con cuatro hijos de 15, 17, 19 y 20 años de edad los cuales tres de ellos estudian y uno trabaja, ella es una mujer que toda su vida ha trabajado para salir adelante, no es la primera vez que ha trabajado con Fundación,  en los créditos anteriores ha demostrado ser  una persona responsable, cumplidora con sus pagos ella posee una pulpería la cual se encuentra ubicada en su casa de habitación  donde ella vende granos básicos, cosméticos, dulces, golosinas ropa entre otros productos. Ella actualmente  está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de granos básicos, cosméticos, ropa, productos congelados, dulces y otros productos, Vilma está muy agradecida con  la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno
texts.en:
Vilma is 41 years old, married, and has four children of the ages 15, 17, 19, and 20. Three of her children attend school and the other works. Vilma is a woman who has worked her life in order to get ahead. This is not the first time that she has worked with Fundación; in her previous loans, she has demonstrated herself to be a responsible person who complied with her payments.

She owns a small grocery store which is located in her home where she sells basic grains, cosmetics, clothing, frozen foods, sweets, and other products. Vilma is very grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide to people of limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua in order to have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to buy and sell food products such as rice, beans, bread, milk, salt, boxes of matches, cigarettes, juices, soft drinks, candies, and cosmetics, among other things.

loans.name: Venceremos Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Venceremos está conformado por 8 integrantes,  siete son madres solteras con 14 hijos bajo su responsabilidad, y un hombre los cuales conforman  el banco Venceremos, todos son personas responsables, trabajadoras. Son originarios del municipio de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Estas personas decidieron unirse, y se apoyan mutuamente en sus diferentes actividades económicas. Francis María es la coordinadora del banco comunal la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad del banco , ella tiene por actividad ecomica una pulpería ubicada en su casa, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestible de consumo diario como arroz, frijoles, pan, leche, sal, caja de fosforo, cigarros, jugos, gaseosas. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta  productos comestible, y en un futuro no muy lejano poder incrementar sus ganancias. E banco comunal Venceremos agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Venceremos” (We Will Overcome) consists of eight members.  Seven of the members are single mothers who are responsible for 14 children among them.  There is one male member.  All of them are responsible and hardworking individuals.  The members are originally from the town of Malpaisillo, a place that is located in the northern part of the country.  These individuals decided to join together so that they could support one another with their various business activites.

Francis María is the Communal Bank coordinator who is in charge of overseeing the group’s responsibilities.  Her business is a small convenience store that is located in her home.  She sells everyday food products such as rice, beans, bread, milk, and salt.  In addition, Francis sells boxes of matches, cigarettes, juices, and sodas.  The goal of her loan is to invest in operating capital for her business of buying and selling food products.  In the not-so-distant future, she would like to increase her earnings.  

The Communal Bank “Venceremos” is grateful for the assistance that Kiva lenders provide to people with limited resources so that they can have the means to earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, bread, milk, salt, matches, cigarettes, juices, and sodas.

loans.name: Sobeida Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Sobeida Auxiliadora de  52 años de edad, casada con tres hijos mayores e independiente. Sobeida se caracteriza por ser una mujer, trabajadora, responsable en sus pagos en tiempo y forma. es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicada en la zona de occidente del país. 
Gracias a su espíritu, y ganas de superación personal, tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, que consisten en vender productos comestible y en cantidades pequeñas como: sobre de shampoo, sobre de café, arroz, frijoles cosidos, aceite, huevos, pan, leche, jugos, gaseosas. Actividad que la desempeña desde hace ocho años y está ubicada en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para brindar buen servicio a sus clientes, y en futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos. La rutina de trabajo de Sobeida es trabajar unas 14 horas diario ofreciendo sus productos a los pobladores de su comunidad. Sobeida Auxiliadora agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Sobeida Auxiliadora is 52 years old, married and has three adult children who are all independent.  Sobeida is known for being hardworking and responsible in making her payments in a timely manner.  She is a native of León, which is located in the western part of the country.

Thanks to her spirit and personal desire to succeed, she runs a small grocery store in which she sells products in small quantities such as shampoo packets, coffee packets, rice, cooked beans, oil, eggs, bread, milk, juices and carbonated soft drinks.  Her store is located in her house and she has been running it now for eight years.

She is requesting this loan to invest in working capital and to stock her store so that she can offer better service to her clients and in the near future generate more income.  Sobeida’s work routine is to work around 14 hours per day offering her products to the members of her community.

Sobeida Auxiliadora is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide for people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her small grocery store with products such as shampoo packets, coffee packets, rice, cooked beans, oil, eggs, bread, milk, juices and carbonated soft drinks.

loans.name: Mawoline

texts.en: Mawoline lives in West Point, which is one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County. She is 27 years old, and is married to a businessman. They have a 6 year old child who is in school and lives at home. For the past 2 years, Mawoline has been operating a shop in the local market where she sells slippers. She received a little money from her husband to start her business, and learned about the business from her mother. She likes her business because it makes money for her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business. She plans to build a house with her profits.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Nuri 2 Group

texts.en:
Ninis is 38 years old, and has 5 children, including Anggi (14 years old) and Ikhsan (10 years old), who are still in school and a 2-year-old toddler, Nur. Her business sells fried chicken and is located 200 meters from her house. She has run this business for 4 years. Her business income will help her save up to buy a motor cycle and help her fulfill her family's needs more easily.

She will use this loan to buy a gas tube, chicken, and rice warmer. She plans to expand her business and have her own kiosk. She is excited for her business because she is the only one who sells fried chicken in her village. Buying more ingredients is the obstacle to running this business.

loans.use: to buy a gas tube, chicken, and rice warmers for her store.

loans.name: Ghina 2 Group

texts.en:
Khadija is the featured borrower of Ghina 2's group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. She is seated in the middle. She has been working in clothing repair for 5 years and does well in her business because of her special talent in this domain. Khadija is a 48-year-old married woman and mother of four children. She works hard to help her husband in making a living and covering their expenses. She is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to pay for her son's college fees.

Ghina is a 22-year-old single woman who has worked in a furniture gallery for 3 years. She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a washing machine that is necessary for her parent's house.

Haifa is a 48-year-old married woman and mother of two children, who has done admin work for 15 years. She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a studying desk for her son.

loans.use: To pay for her son's college fees

loans.name: Korto G.

texts.en: Korto lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County. She is 21 years old and has a five year old child who is attending school and lives at home. For the past three years, she has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in the local market. She enjoys interacting with her customers and the profit she makes daily. Having money for her expenses makes her proud of her business. She faces the problem of high prices of food materials. She is requesting a loan to purchase more chicken, rice, oil, spare rib, meat, pig foot, chicken feet, and pepper for her business. Her dream is to become a big business woman and buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken, rice, oil, spare rib, meat, pig foot, chicken feet, and pepper for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Susan Micaela

texts.es:
Susan tiene 22 años de edad, es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que ella con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación trabaja como promotora en una tienda de venta de celulares y con el fruto de su trabajo solventa con gran esfuerzo sus estudios, ya que ella se encuentra estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas en una universidad de su ciudad. 

Cada día Susan se levanta muy temprano para ir a su centro de labores, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y luego estudia por las noches; ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y ser el orgullo de sus padres.

Susan está muy contenta y agradecida ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá pagar la matrícula y mensualidad de su universidad y así poder seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera y poder apoyar a su familia”.
texts.en:
Susan is 22 years old.  She is a young woman with a strong desire to get ahead, and for that reason she works very hard as a promoter in a cell phone store.  She works hard to pay for her studies and she is persuing a career in business administration at the university in her city.  

Every day, Susan gets up very early to go to the store - where she works about eight hours a day -  and later studies at night.  She feels she is getting ahead because she is responsible and is eager to improve her life and make her parents proud.

Susan is very grateful for the help she has received to pay her tuition and monthly enrollment fees at her university.  She is also happy to be able to continue fighting to make her greatest dream a reality:  "To finish school and support her family."

loans.use: to pay for tuition and monthly enrollment fees.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a humble 51-year-old woman from Msambweni.  She is the mother of five children. She is a merchant and sells firewood. This business generates reasonable amounts of daily income.  She is asking for the loan to buy bundles of firewood to sell. 

Her plans for the future are to improve her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy bundles of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is still in her retail shop, which is doing very well. She is one person who always takes advantage of every opportunity that comes across. She thanks Kiva lenders for their mercy and kindness, to help people of low income. She testifies that the previous loan was of great help to her.

Fatuma is asking for another loan that will enable her to stock up her retail shop's merchandise, with items like flour, snacks, soft drinks, and basic grains. Her aim is to grow her business and, probably, hire some employees.

loans.use: to stock up her retail shop's merchandise, with items like flour, snacks, soft drinks, and basic grains

loans.name: Fatumata

texts.en:
Fatumata lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county. She is 32 years old, and she is married with three children ages 11 and 15, who are in school and live at home. For ten years now she has been operating a shop in her community where she sells soft drinks, cold water and bread. She received a little amount from her husband to start her business and learned it from her mother. 

Fatumata likes her business because she makes a profit, so she is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks, cold water, and bread for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, cold water, and bread for her business.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market towns in Montserrado county. She is 45 years old, and she is a widow who has five children, from 20 to 30 years old. Only one is in school and lives at home.

For the past three years Comfort has been selling bread and soft drinks in her community. She got money from her oldest sister to start this business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bread and soft drinks for her business. She wishes to buy land and build a house for her children, one day.

loans.use: to purchase more bread and soft drinks for her business,

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr: Akoko est une jeune dame de 31ans. Elle est mariée à un restaurateur et ils ont 03 enfants tous à l’école. Ils sont âgés de 10,08 et 03ans. Pour prêter main forte à son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, elle fait le commerce de pagnes depuis 2003. Elle expose ses marchandises sur étalage et vend de différentes variétés de pagnes. Afin d’avoir une boutique et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille, elle sollicite un second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises, revendre et pouvoir atteindre ses objectifs à l'avenir.
texts.en: Akoko is a young woman of 31 years. She is married to a restauranteur and they have three children, all in school. They are aged 10, 8, and 3 years. To lend a hand to her spouse for the household expenses, she has sold pagnes (colorful wax cloth) since 2003. She shows her merchandise in a stall and sells different varieties of pagnes. In order to have a store and to improve her family's living conditions, she is asking for a second loan from WAGES to buy merchandise, resell it, and be able to meet her future goals.

loans.use: to buy pagnes

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca live in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county. She is 47 years old, married and has five children between the ages of 9 to 27 years old. Two of them are in school and live at home. Her husband is a businessman. For the past 22 years she been selling body creams, spray, bath soap, etc. in her community. Rebecca received the money from her husband to start this business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more body cream, spray, bath soap, etc for her business. She wishes to buy land and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, spray, bath soap, etc for her business.

loans.name: Dorcas Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nambula, membre du groupe d’affaire  Dorcas, est entrepreneur, âgée de 50 ans, mariée à un commerçant et mère de 8 enfants  tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des œuvres d’art et cela fait plus de 10ans. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 16 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit va  lui servir de s’approvisionner en différentes œuvres d’arts  à marchander dans la rue. Elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et  prospérer dans son bussness. Madame Nambula remercie Hekima pour ses actions.
texts.en: The borrower Nambula, member of the Dorcas business group, is an entrepreneur. She is 50 years old, married to a storekeeper, and mother of eight children, all in school. She has worked selling artwork for more than ten years. However, she has just finished 16 loan cycles with Hekima. This new loan will be used to stock up with different works of art to sell in the street. Her goal is to educate her children and to make her business prosper. Madame Nambula thanks Hekima for its actions.

loans.use: to buy different types of artwork

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Afin d’acheter un congélateur pour agrandir son commerce de jus de fruits, d’eau et de glaçon, madame Abla âgée de 37ans est mariée à un comptable et ils ont un enfant de 07ans qui va à l’école. Une personne l’aide dans l’exercice de son activité. Avec les profits qu'elle réalisera, madame Abla veut avoir une boutique car son activité se déroule à domicile et assurer le bien être de la famille.
texts.en: Madame Abla is asking for a loan order to buy a freezer to grow her business selling fruit juice, water, and ice. Madame Abla, 37 years old, is married to an accountant and they have one seven year old child who goes to school. One person helps Madame Abla with her business. With the profits that she will make, Madame Abla wants to have a store, because she runs from business from home, and to provide for her family's well being.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Zamu

texts.en:
Zamu lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, and all her children are in school. She has no additional family members. She lives in her own house. The family has no access to piped water or to electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.  

She sells green bananas at the market, on a retail basis. She also has a charcoal stall, where she earns additional income. She has been in business for the past 10 years. She works six days a week. Her major challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

She has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO. She would like to buy more bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal, to resell.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal, to resell

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 44 years old and is married with three children who are aged between 20 and 16 years old.

Damaris has a general store that she has been running for the past six years, and she has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy cooking oil, maize flour, etc. to add to her stock.

She hopes to expand her business in the near future and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, maize flour, etc.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu has been involved in food vending--selling from her home and door to door. She has been in this business for the last five years.

She has been improving her economic situation now that her small business is more stable. However, her cry is to see that she sells from a permanent place and even grows to own a hotel in future.

With this loan, she will increase her ingredients by purchasing flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children; all her children are in school. She has no additional family members. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.  

She sells second-hand clothes at the market, on a retail basis. She also has a motorcycle, from which she gets additional income. She has been in business for the past seven years. She works seven days a week. Her major challenges are transportation and seasonality.

Prossy has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, to buy more bales of used clothes. Her aspirations are to open up a boutique selling first-class clothes and shoes, and to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes to resell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 52 years old and lives in Ndunyu Njeru. She is married and has three children, who are aged between 7 and 25 years.

Esther is a farmer. She has been engaged in farming for many years. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD, to enable her to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use in her farm.

She hopes to be the leading farmer in her area.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University. He has six children and has been doing this work for 10 years. His primary income sources are milk and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "dairy management!" His biggest challenge is the "high cost of farm inputs." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "lelmet." He will use the loan of KES 50,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow.

John was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "efficiency."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "record keeping."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?" John replied "surplus to assist in payment of school fees."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. John owns the following: "cow, poultry" but does not own "pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household "mosquito net" but does not have "electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD."

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Jastice

texts.en:
Jastice is married man aged 28 years old blessed with two children aged six and two. He is a passion fruit farmer and has been in the farm for a period of two years earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

He is now servicing his third loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase fertilizers and pesticides, till more land, and plant more passion fruit.  

The profits he earns from the sell of passion fruit will be used to repay the loan. His dream is to expand his passion fruit farm and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides and till more land

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Âgée de 42ans, mère de 03 enfants tous à l’école, madame dédé est revendeuse de céréales à domicile. Elle exerce seule cette activité depuis 1990  et par moment rencontre des problèmes de méventes. Elle veut stocker des céréales c’est pour cela, elle fait un premier crédit à WAGES. Avec le profit tiré de la vente, elle veut ouvrir un magasin et modifier plus le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en: This client is a 42-year old woman with three children, all in school. She sells cereals out of her home. She has been in this business on her own since 1990, and at the moment she is facing a  slump. She would like to stock up on cereals, which is why she is taking out her first loan with WAGES. She would like to use her profits to open a store and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en: Bendu lives in West Point, Liberia, one of the most populated and well-known areas in Montserrado County. She is 30 years old and single. Bendu has three children between the ages of 3 and 7 years old. Two of her children are in school, and all of them live at home. For the past four years she been making and selling tea, fried eggs, and bread in her community. She spends six hours in her food shop. She received money from her oldest sister to start this business. Bendu requests a loan to purchase more tea, over-tea (fixed coffee), bread, milk, eggs, oil, and butter for her business. She wishes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more tea, over-tea (fixed coffee), bread, milk, eggs, oil, and butter for her business

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University. He has two children and has been doing this work for five years. His primary income sources are milk, crops, and transportation services.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "dairy keeping!" His biggest challenge is "drought conditions." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "lelan." Stanley will use the loan of KES 60,000 requested from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow.

Stanley was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "fair interest rates." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "saving for the future."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?" Stanley replied "better nutrition and more disposable income."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Stanley owns the following: "cow, motorcycle" but does not own "pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household "mosquito net, solar power, TV" but does not have "electricity, running water, sewing machine, DVD."

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en: Rukia is grateful for the previous loan that was of great help to her. She is asking for another loan to invest in her grocery store. She tells us that she diversified her line of operation, but she also runs her food stall. Both businesses are doing well. Rukia will use this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to stock her grocery.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to stock her grocery.

loans.name: Suliko

texts.en:
Suliko is 29 years old. He lives in Telavi District with his mother. Suliko requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Suliko requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Suliko has already rented a place in the center of the city. The place is very profitable to open a fast food stall, where he will sell doner. With the received credit, Suliko will purchase the stock of raw materials to make doner and a refrigerator for juices. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a fast food stall and sell doner

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all her children do go to school. She sells secondhand clothes at the market on retail basis. She takes care of one additional family member (mother). She has been in this business for the last three years. She works six days a week. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. She has requested a loan of UGX 1,500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. Her aspirations are to start importing used clothes and also to buy a plot of land and build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Chege

texts.en:
Chege is 53 years old and married to Susan with five children. He does a quarry mining business in Ndunyu Njeru town. He sells the building stones and building blocks to various construction sites and it has been profitable.

This will be his first loan term and he plans to buy quarry equipment since this will enable him to increase his production. He also plans to buy more stock of stones and building blocks to sell. He anticipates to generate more profits, which he will use to boost his farming business by buying seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Chege hopes to buy more pieces of land for quarrying to therefore make more profits and be able to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy more quarry equipment

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 35 years old from Ndunyu Njeru and is married with three children who are all in school.

Peter is a farmer and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy seedlings and fertilizers for use in his farm. He is optimistic that his farm will do well after the loan.

He hopes to see his farm expand in the near future and to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 32 years old from Ndunyu Njeru and is married with two children who are aged between eight and three years old. 

Ibrahim is a farmer and has been in it for the past six years. He has applied for his seventh loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use in his farm.

He hopes to improve his family's standard of living in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 40-year-old man, who lives with his wife and their four children. Two of the children are in secondary school, one is in primary school, and the youngest one has not yet started going to school. Charles's wife does subsistence farming, while he deals with poultry.

Charles supplies poultry to the nearby hotels. He has been in the poultry business for a little over four years. At first, he got help from a government project that was helping farmers in the area. However, the project ended. It was then that he decided to seek support from UGAFODE Microfinance. With this loan, he would like to buy chicken feed and chicks.

He hopes that he can increase his yields in the poultry farm. The major challenge that he faces is difficulty in getting transport for the eggs and chickens. Charles is focused and hard-working. His wish is to increase his family's income and improve their livelihood.

The picture shows Charles and the credit officer. The credit officer is the one in a pink jacket.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed and chicks to raise

loans.name: Guadalupe Mariela

texts.es:
Guadalupe Mariela,  originaria del  departamento de Masaya,Su núcleo familiar es de cuatro personas, la mama, el esposo y una hija menor de edad,  con 37 años de edad, posee su negocio propio, manifiesta que a raíz de que la situación económica no estaba muy bien, se resolvió a emprender su negocio y vio que se ganaba bien viajando a otros países y decidió en viajar a nuestro país hermano San salvador, este consiste en compra la mercadería aquí en Nicaragua tales como cerámica de barro, sillas abuelitas, cuadros pintados de pared, chinos de manilas, hamacas unipersonales y matrimoniales. Luego viaja hacia San Salvador y cuando viene de regreso también trae mercadería como perfumen, joyas de plata y ropa variada estos para varón y mujer, y ofrecerlas a sus clientes radicados en Masaya y que venden en  el mercado municipal.
Gracias a su esfuerzo ya tiene 6 años en el mercado comercializando sus productos, ella es una mujer emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superar, crecer mas en su negocio y darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Actualmenye ella Necesita comprar una mercadería  para surtir su negocio y del cual le estan demandando, entre los que se mencionan, productos de la Avon y la zermat (perfumeria), y ropa como blusas y pantalones variados, de tal manera que le de mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Guadalupe Mariela is a native of the department of Masaya. Her nuclear family is composed of four people: her mother, her husband, and one daughter who is still a minor. 

At 37 years old, Guadalupe Mariela has her own business. She explains that because the economic situation was not very good, she resolved to start her own business. She saw that traveling to other countries was profitable, and she decided to travel to San Salvador, in Nicaragua's sister country, El Salvador. Her travel consists of buying merchandise like pottery, rocking chairs, wall art, single and double hammocks, and other items at home in Nicaragua, and then traveling to San Salvador. When she comes back, she brings merchandise like perfume, silver jewelry, and a variety of clothing for men and women. She sells what she brings back to her customers who live in Masaya and who sell in the municipal market.

Thanks to her efforts, she has been in this business selling her products for six years already. She is an enterprising woman with a strong desire to improve herself, to grow her business more, and to give her family a better quality of life.

Currently, she needs to buy merchandise to stock her business with the goods that people are asking for. These include the items already mentioned as well as Avon products, Zermat perfume, and a variety of clothing like blouses and pants, so that she can earn a better income.

loans.use: to purchase Avon products along with a variety of pants and shirts.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University. She has four children and has been doing this work for eight years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: she "loves animals and enjoys most when they are grazing!" Her biggest challenge is "getting dairy feeds, more so during the dry season." Animals on the farm have been given the names of the "brown one and the black headed one."

Rael was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied that she liked the terms of the loan and the fact that Juhudi is farmer-centered. This client also said she learned "about leadership and proper planning" during Juhudi's required microfinance training session. She will use the loan requested to buy a dairy cow.

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?" Rael replied that from the loan proceeds she will be able to feed and educate her children.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Rael owns the following: cow, poultry, and pump but does not own a pig, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net in the household but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Jusufjon

texts.ru:
Юсуфчон молодой мужчина, женат  и имеет троих детей.  Занимается производством блочных кирпичей а также продает уголь.  Зимой очень много спроса на уголь и он получает очень хороший доход от этого бизнеса. Юсуфчон очень энергичный мужчина и всегда старается работать и зарабатывать на жизнь.  Он о многом мечтает, например очень хочет чтобы его дети учились в ВУЗ-ах, хочет отремонтировать свой дом,который не ремонтировался уже много лет,хочет жить в нормальных условиях, и для того чтобы осуществить эти планы он очень много работает.
 Сейчас у него очень много клиентов, которые покупают у него уголь. Юсуфчон хочет закупить уголь но у него нет достаточно денежных средств, поэтому он обратился в Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. 
На полученный кредит Юсуфчон планирует закупить несколько тон угля и надеется после продажи получить хорошую прибыль.  Он очень надеется на поддержку от организации Арванд и заранее благодарит.
texts.en: Jusufjon is a young man, married, with three children. He manufactures modular  bricks and also sells coal. In the wintertime the demand for coal is high, and he earns a good income from his business. Jusufjon is very energetic, and always tries to find work and earn a living. He has many dreams: for example, he would really like for his children to receive a college education. He would like to renovate his house, which has not been renovated for many years, and live in decent conditions. In order to realize these plans, he works a lot. At present he has many customers buying coal. Jusufjon would like to stock up coal but lacks financial means, which is why he turned to Arvand for financial support. He plans to use his loan to buy several tons of coal and hopes to have a good profit after selling it. He very much hopes for support from Arvand and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase coal.

loans.name: Wallace

texts.en:
Wallace is 25 years old from Olkalou and is a single man without children.

Wallace has an electronics business that he has been doing for the past two years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy more electronics, e.g. adapters, electrical wires, etc. to add to his stock for sale.

He hopes to buy a piece of land in the near future and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy adapters, electrical wires, etc.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: Eusebio de 57 años de edad, es una persona muy responsable quien durante muchos años se ha dedicado  a realizar la misma actividad para sostener su hogar, él trabaja como pescador actividad que ha ido perfeccionando con el paso de los años, aprendizaje que ha transmitido a sus hijos. Eusebio todos los días en horas de la madrugada sale en su pequeña lancha a arrojar las redes para recaudar la mayor cantidad de pescado posible el cual posteriormente comercializa con personas del mercado. Eusebio solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda realizarle todos los arreglos a su lancha la cual es básica para realizar su trabajo, así mismo para comprar más hilo y elaborar redes nuevas, con esto Eusebio espera contar con las mejores condiciones para realizar la pesca y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Eusebio, who is 57 years old, is a very responsible person who has earned his living the same way for many years to support his household: he works as a fisherman. He has been perfecting his fishing over the years, and has shared his knowledge with his children. 

Every day, Eusebio goes out in his little motorboat in the very early morning to cast his nets in order to catch the greatest possible quantity of fish, which he will later sell to people in the market. 

Eusebio is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that he can make repairs to his boat, which is essential for his work. He will also buy more filament and make new nets. With these improvements, Eusebio hopes to have the best conditions for fishing and obtaining better earnings.

loans.use: to repair his boat and buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik lives in Shirakavan village and is involved in agriculture. He keeps livestock which currently includes 2 cows, 19 sheep, and 30 chickens. He also cultivates wheat and barley and grows apple and pear trees. 

Gagik does his best in order to gather good harvest, sell it in the local market, and get high income. 

He lives with his wife, two daughters, and a son. As Gagik is the only breadwinner in the family and agriculture is the only source of his income, it is very difficult for him to sustain his family and cover other operational costs.

Gagik has applied for this loan to pay for forage for feeding the livestock. This will enable him to feed his livestock and continue the expansion of his farm. The loan is very important for Gagik to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding livestock

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Rachael lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and one goes to school. She sells secondhand clothes on retail basis. She sells her products door-to-door. She takes care of one additional family member (young brother). She has been in business for the last six years. She works six days a week. Her major challenge is transportation and seasonality. She has requested for a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT SACCO and she would like to buy a bale of secondhand clothes. Her aspirations are to become a wholesaler, educate her children up to university level, and to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major expenses monthly include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is 27 years old and from Nakuru. He is married with four children who are all in school.

Festus has a motorcycle business that he has been doing for the past four years. He has applied for second loan from KADET LTD, after successfully paying the previous loan, to enable him to service his motorcycle. He is optimistic that his transportation business will do better after the loan.

He hopes to expand his business and buy another motorcycle in the future.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya which is the training ground for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has three children.  Her primary income sources are selling milk and growing crops, and she has been doing this work for 13 years. 

She stated that what was most enjoyable about farming was 'selling milk to cater for the needs of the family!'  Her biggest challenges are 'the high costs of feeding the animals especially during the dry season.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Lelbonget.'

Jane  will use the loan amount to buy and insure a dairy cow. She was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, 'I was introduced to Juhudi by a friend in the group ...'  Jane was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session and replied, 'how to use credit assets to generate income to repay the credit and to develop oneself.'

Jane's largest monthly expense is farming costs. When she was asked, 'how will this loan benefit your family?' Jane replied, 'more income and nutrients for the family  from the milk produced.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jane owns the following: 'cow and poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower does not have 'mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and sent the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a single man from Olkalou who is 30 years old. 

He has a transport business that he has been running for the past year. John has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to buy a motorcycle. 

He hopes to buy a piece of land in the near future.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, aged 26, is from Nakuru and is a single man without children. 

He has a farming business and has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy a cow which will help boost his dairy production. He is optimistic that his business will do better after the loan.

Samuel hopes to be a leading dairy farmer in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a  dairy cow

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice lives in West Point, one of the most populated and best-known markets in Montserrado county. She is 27 years old and has two children aged four and six years old, who are in school and live at home. For the past three years she has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in the local market. One of the problems she faces are that the prices are too high. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes daily, and having money to pay her expenses makes her proud of her business. She is asking for a loan to buy more chicken, rice, oil, spare ribs, meat, pig feet, and chicken feet for her business. Her dream is to become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy more chicken, rice, oil, spare ribs, meat, pig feet, and chicken feet for her business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys lives in the western point of one of the most populated and well known market areas in Montserrado County.  She is 28 years old, and she lives with her boyfriend and their two children aged 8 months and 5 years.  Only the oldest one is in school.  For two years she has been selling slippers in her community market.  One of her challenges is reduced income because of low inventory.  She enjoys the interaction with her customers and profits she generates every day.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business. Her dream is to have a house of their own.

loans.use: to purchase more slipper for her business,

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet lives in West Point located in Montserrado County, which is known as the most commercial city in Liberia.  Janet is 46 years old, and has three children between the ages of 11 and 23 years.  For the past 20 years she has been selling charcoal in a shop at the local market.  Some of the problems she faces is small capital.  She spends 8 hours a day in her business and enjoys the profits she makes every day.  Having money for her expenses makes her proud of her business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell at her business.  Her dream is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 65-year-old married man and father of two children. He has been working by selling home products since 2003. His business is going fine to cover his family's expenses, but needs a small external push to increase his income and develop his business.
Mohamad is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his merchandise with newly released home products, that will surely attract new customers’ attention, and increase his sales.
This is Mohamad's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. He has a good repayment history. His previous loan helped a lot in improving his income and developing his standard of living.
He hopes to keep improving his business as much as he can, through expanding the shop and increasing his merchandise.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with new released home products.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all of her children are in school. She sells green bananas and charcoal at the market. She has no additional family members. She has been in this business for the last 6 years. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal and bunches of green banana. She would like to build rental houses.  She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Mary J.

texts.en: Mary J. lives in West Point, Montserrado County, which is noted as the most commercial city in Liberia.  She is 48 years old, and a widow with five children between 20 and 28 years old. For the past seven years she has been baking shortbread and selling it in the local market.  One of the problems she faces is that she has less capital since the prices of things are high in the market. She enjoys the profit she makes every day, having money for her expenses; this makes her proud of her business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more sugar, flour, baking powder, oil, butter, etc. for her business.  Her dream is to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, flour, baking powder, oil, butter, etc. for baking shortbread,

loans.name: Mamia

texts.en: Mamia live in West Point, Montserrado County which is noted as the most commercial city in Liberia.  She is 42 years old and has four children between 15 and 25 years old.  Only one is still at home and attends school.  For the past 5 years Mamia has been selling bread and soft drinks in the local market on a table.  One of the problems she faces is lack of capital. She enjoys the profit she makes every day to have money for her expenses.  She is proud of her business, and is requesting a loan to purchase more bread and soft drinks for her business.  Her dream is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bread and soft drinks for her business,

loans.name: Jerline

texts.en: Jerline lives in West Point, which has one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County.  She is 32 years old, married, and has two children aged 4 and 11 years that live at home and attend school.  For 4 years she has been running a shop where she sells artificial hair.  Some of the problems she faces is the rainy season, since she does not have a good shop.  She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profits she makes.  Having food in her home makes her proud of her business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more artificial hair to sell in her business.  Her dream is to have a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair to sell in her business

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en: Eseza lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children which are all in school. She sells green bananas and charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has no additional family members. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.   Her aspirations are to buy a truck for delivering her goods and also educate her children up to university level. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major expenses include monthly school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren is involved in agriculture. He keeps 5 cows and 50 chickens, cultivates wheat and also owns a plot of land where apple and pear trees are grown. Together with his wife, Suren works hard to gather a good harvest and sell it in the local market. He has applied for this loan to pay for forage for feeding his livestock. The loan is very important for Suren to cover some costs and be able to improve his family's living conditions.
Suren lives with his wife and daughter in the Shirakavan village in the Shirak region.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding his livestock.

loans.name: Maima

texts.en: Maima lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County.  She is 41 years old, married, and has five children between 7 and 20 years old.  Two are in school and all of them live at home.  Her husband is a businessman.  For the past five years she has been selling rice, pepper, palm oil, etc., in her community.  She got money from her husband to start her business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, palm oil, etc., for her business.  She wishes to buy land and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, palm oil, etc., for her business

loans.name: Yassah B.

texts.en: Yassah is 26 years old and lives in West Point.  She’s single and has a nine years old child that is in school and lives at home.  For the past nine years she has been selling sugar, biscuits, pepper, salt, onions, candy, etc. in the market.  She started this business with a small amount of money that she received from her father and she learned about the retail business from friends. What she likes about this business is the way customers buy from her and the profit she is able to earn from her business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more sugar, biscuits, pepper, salt, onions, and candy for her business. Her future plans are to save money and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, biscuits, pepper, salt, onions, and candy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water pump for irrigation and poultry birds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals and fertilizers.

loans.name: Benetta

texts.en: Benetta lives in West Point, where one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County is located.  She is 33 years old, single, and has an 18 year old child that is in school and lives at home.  Her boyfriend is a businessman.  For the past six years she has been selling cold water and soft drinks in her community.  She got money from her boyfriend to start this business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more cold water and soft drinks for her  business.  She wishes to buy land and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more cold water and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials for constructing a dairy unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Arther

texts.en:
Arther, a quarry worker in Ndunyu Njeru used his previous loan amount to start poultry farming by buying chicken for rearing. It has been productive from the sale of chickens and eggs thereby being profitable and this has enabled him to provide for the needs of his family.

This will be his third loan and he plans to use the amount to buy a heifer cow for rearing. This will enable him get milk to sell which is usually in high demand. He will use the generated profits to pay school fees for his children.
Arther hopes to buy more land for quarrying and thereby make more income.

loans.use: to buy a heifer cow.

loans.name: Pariken

texts.en:
Pariken is 30 years old, married and blessed with two children. He is a livestock trader in Narok and has been running the business for the past six years making a monthly income of KES. 20,000

He has requested to borrow a second loan of KES. 40,000 from KADET LTD which he intends to purchase more livestock for resale. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost business.
His future dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to acquire livestock for sale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known market areas in Montserrado County. She is 30 years old, married with two children that live at home and are in school.  For two years she has been selling cosmetics in her community, and reduced income is the problem she faces now. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she generates every day.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics to increase the inventory for her business. Her dream is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children who are all in school, and she also takes care of two additional family members. She has sold second hand clothes at the market on a retail basis for the last 10 years, working seven days a week. Her major challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

Florence has requested a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO. She would like to use it to buy a bale of second hand clothes and shoes. Her aspirations are to start importing used clothes, to support her children's education to university level and also build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses each month include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rosetta M.

texts.en: Rosetta is 35 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County. She is married and has two children ages 1 and 4.  For the past seven years she has been selling slippers in the local market.  She has a lot of customers and makes a profit.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business.  She hopes to improve her business and send her children to a quality school.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. She has 7 children and has been farming for 20 years. Her primary income sources are eggs, tea, and crops.

She stated that the most enjoyable thing about farming is the benefits during harvesting! Her biggest challenge is securing financing. The animals at the farm are named “Imburi". She will use the loan to buy poultry birds.

Zipporah was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied that they charge reasonable interest rates.  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session which she responsed, the loaning process and requirements for the organization.
Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked “How will this loan benefit your family?”, Zipporah replied that it will increase her income.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Zipporah owns the following: 'poultry' but does not own 'cow, pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en: Saidat is married with five children; none of her children go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member. (Grandchild). She has a tailoring business and has been doing this for 30 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials (fabric), threads and an electric sewing machine. She generates additional income through selling green bananas. She works in a shop that she rents and works six days a week and sells both wholesale and retail. Her major business challenges include thieves, late payers and ever increasing prices of clothing materials. She has aspirations of owning a tailoring school and also to sell only wholesale. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, paying for utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of clothing materials (fabrics).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials to construct a  dairy unit.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a widow with three adult children. She is also a grandmother who takes care of her grandchildren. For ten years, she has had a business selling charcoal at the market seven days a week. She generates additional income from rental rooms. Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves and defaulters.

Mary has applied for a loan of 2,700,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She aspries to become a wholesaler and also to build more rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes feeding the family and paying their utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known market towns in Montserrado county. She is a single, 28-year-old high school graduate and for the past year she has been selling slippers. She enjoys buying goods for her business and the profits that she receives. Chantal is  requesting a loan to purchase more slippers to sell. She plans to send her children to school and save money for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 30-year-old woman living in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County. She stopped her education at 9th grade. She is married with two children aged 2 and 4; they both live at home. For the past 5 years she has been selling slippers in the local market. Sometimes buying is difficult, but most of the time she realizes a profit, which she uses to buy more goods. She also saves some. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business. She hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is widowed with seven children. Only two of her children to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren) . She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for 3 years. She sells to all categories of people but on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works six days a week at the market. Her major business challenges include thieves and the ever-increasing prices of used clothes in Uganda. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. She has 3 children and has been doing this work for 5 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, tea, crops, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Selling milk, beans, maize and rice!" Her biggest challenge is transportation and untimely payment from customers. Her animals are not named. She will use 30000 KES of the loan to buy poultry birds. With the remaining 30,000 KES, she will construct a dairy unit for the animals.

Peris was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan. She replied: "It has an affordable interest rate." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "That microfinance reaches the unreached people like me".

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?", Peris replied "My children will go to a good school, and eat well."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Peris owns: a cow, a pig, poultry, a pump, a bicycle, and a motorcycle but does not have electricity in her house.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds and materials for constructing a dairy unit.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. She has 2 children and has been doing this work for 5 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, job salary, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Farming returns!" Her biggest challenge is disease. The animal on the farm is named Nyabarati. She will use the loan of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a dairy unit.

Florence was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, and she replied, "The low interest charges." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "The loan process."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?", Florence replied "It will Increase my family's income."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Florence owns the following: a cow, poultry, and a bicycle but does not own a pig, a pump, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, solar power, and a sewing machine but does not have electricity, running water, TV, or a DVD player.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase materials for constructing a dairy unit.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. He has one child and has been a farmer for three years, with his main income sources being milk, eggs, tea and other crops. He states that his profits are the thing he most enjoys about farming, while lack of finances are his biggest challenge. His highest monthly expenses are business related.

Abel chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of the agency's convenience for him and he learnt about its loan process during Juhudi's compulsory micro-finance training session. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Abel replied 'Increase income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated and any change in living standards that result from loans are measured. Currently, Abel owns cattle and poultry but not pigs, a pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. His household has a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV or DVD player. 

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Maa Pandabasuni Shg Group

texts.en:
These 12 women from the small village of Odisha came together and formed Maa Pandabasuni SHG in 2012. Puspa was selected as the leader of Maa Pandabasuni SHG. The lady who is sitting in the second position from the right side of the photograph wearing a yellow and black colored saree is Puspa. 

She is 32 years old and lives with her husband and her two sons. She has been involved in vegetable cultivation for two years and her husband has been involved in paddy cultivation for five years. As a farmer, her husband has knowledge of vegetable cultivation and he is helping her in this activity. What they earn is not sufficient to manage their family. She has requested a loan to purchase hybrid seed, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the labor charges.

The family income will increase and they will be inspired to do more. She says that the income will help to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed, fertilizers and pesticides for vegetable cultivation

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. He has six children and has been a farmer for 22 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops and other personal business activities. He has given the animals on his farm the name 'Nyagacho.' The thing he most likes about farming are the assured returns from his work, while his biggest challenge is 'lack of capital.' His highest monthly expenses are his children's school fees.

James chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan due to the convenience of meeting with its staff and the training they offer. He said he learnt about the importance of saving during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', James replied 'Increase family income and help meet basic needs.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated and changes in living standards that result from loans are measured. Currently, James owns cows, poultry and a bicycle, but does not own pigs, a pump, a motorcycle or an automobile. His household has mosquito nets, solar power and a TV but does not have electricity, running water, a sewing machine or a DVD player.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and materials for a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known market areas in Montserrado county. She is 33 years old and has two children, age 9 and 15 years old. They are in school and live at home.

For the past four years she has been selling rice, pepper, palm oil, and others items on a table. One problem she faces is the rainy season.  

She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes. It keeps her busy and makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, palm oil, and other items for her business. Her plans is to build a house for her children .

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, palm oil, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known market areas in Montserrado county. She is 28 years old and she stopped her education at grade 5. She is single and has two children, age 4 and 10, who live at home and are in school.

For five years she has been selling bread and cookies in her community. One of the problems she faces is small income.

She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes, which enables her to buy food for her home. This makes her proud of her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase sugar, flour, baking powder, etc. for her business. In the near future she hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, baking powder, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children, and one of her children goes to school. She sells charcoal, tomatoes and green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She takes care of three additional family members. She has been in this business for the last 6 years. She works seven days a week. Her major challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

She has requested a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal and bunches of green bananas. Her aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to build rental houses. She lives in her own house where the family has no access to piped water or electricity. Her major expenses monthly include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas and bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with six children, and one of her children goes to school. She sells charcoal, tomatoes and green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She takes care of two additional family members. She has been in business for the last 20 years. She gets additional income from rental houses. She works seven days a week. Her major challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal, bunches of green bananas and boxes of tomatoes.   Her aspirations are to educate her children to university level and also to become a wholesaler. She lives in her own house where the family has no access to piped water or electricity. Her major expenses monthly include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, boxes of tomatoes and bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evan lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. He has three children and has been farming for eight years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "I enjoy farming in fishing, tea planting." His biggest challenge is "Lack of finance to enhance my business." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Maridadi and Nyabarati." He will use the loan of 30,000 KES to construct a dairy unit.

Evan was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "I joined Kilimo due to their terms in their savings." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "That if I take loan and manage it well, I improve my lifestyle."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?" Evan replied, "Take my children to school, eat and live well."
