As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Evan owns the following: cow, poultry, pump, but does not own pig, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile. 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito net, electricity, TV, but does not have solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase materials for constructing a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for constructing a dairy unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase water tanks for irrigation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry birds and construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret lives in West Point. She is 28 years old and has an 8-year-old child that is in school and lives at home. For the past two years she has been selling pig feet from a table. One of the problems she faces is the rainy season. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes. Keeping busy makes Margaret proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pig feet for her business. Her dream is to have a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more pig feet for her business.

loans.name: Alexis S.

texts.en: Alexis is 25 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county. She’s single and she is a tenth grade student. For the past nine years she has been selling bread and soft drinks. She started this business with a little amount of money that she received from her boyfriend, and she learned this way of selling from her mother. What she likes about this business is that it helps her to pay her school fees. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bread and soft drinks for her business.  Her future plan is to save money and to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more bread and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Joema

texts.en:
Joema, age 41, has operated a "cook shop" (a small local restaurant) for the past 20 years. She received the start-up money for her venture from her husband, who runs his own business, and her mother taught her the skills needed for the business. Joema and her husband have four children between the ages of 14 and 24 years. The family lives in West Point. Joema enjoys her business and appreciates the profit it brings her.

Joema is requesting a loan to purchase vita, bonnie fish, spear rid, rice, coal and pig foot for her business.

Her goal is to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vita, bonnie fish, spear rid, rice, coal, and pig foot for her business

loans.name: Sophiel

texts.en: Sophiel lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county.  She is 35 years old, married and has two children, aged 15 and 20, that live at home.  For 3 years she has been running a table where she sells body powder and spray.  One of the problems she faces is the rainy season. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and profit she makes.  She is proud of her business because it is her business that is able to give her money every day.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more body powder and spray for her business.  In the near future she wants to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more body powder and spray for her business.

loans.name: Mehdi

texts.en: This is the second loan for Mehdi. He is very thankful to Kiva and its lenders for helping him. But now he again needs in your help. Mehdi now needs a loan of 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy more calves for his agriculture business. Mehdi is 23 years old.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, and two of her children are in school. She has no additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to neither piped water nor electricity. Her major expenses monthly include school fees, rent and food. 

She sells second-hand shoes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last two years. She works seven days a week. Her major challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand shoes. Her aspirations are to buy a plot of land and also to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Kadia

texts.en: Kadia lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known market areas in Montserrado county. She is 30 years old and has three children, ages 3, 8, and 12, who are in school and live at home. For the past three years Kadia has been selling rice in her community. One of the problems she faces is the rainy season. She enjoys the interaction with her customers, and the profit she makes every day makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice for her business.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is 30 years old and lives in Montserrado County, that is has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia.  She is married with four children between 2 to 13, which are in school and live at home. She has been selling uniforms for the past 7 years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her husband. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more uniforms. In the future she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more uniforms.

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.en:
Aramais is from Goris and is involved in cattle breeding. His livestock currently includes 4 cows, a mother pig, 10 little pigs and 10 chickens. Agriculture is the only source of income for this family and Aramais does his best to earn a high income.
Aramais lives with his wife and 3 year old daughter. He grows and fattens little pigs, then sells them at a higher price. As Aramais is the only breadwinner in the family he would like to expand his business.
Aramais has applied for this loan to pay for 3 calves and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan will help him to earn more income and ensure a better future for his young family.

loans.use: to buy three calves and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Heriqnaz

texts.en:
Heriqnaz is from Bayandur village and is involved in agriculture. She owns a farm which currently includes 3 cows, 6 pigs and 22 chickens. She gets milk, which she uses in cheese production and beef which she sells in the local market. Herqinaz also cultivates wheat and sells the gathered harvest.
Heriqnaz lives with her husband, mother-in-law, son and twin daughters. Agriculture is the only source of income for this big family. Heriqnaz's monthly income is enough only for covering family's basic needs.
Heriqnaz has applied for this loan to pay for forage to feed the livestock.
The loan is very important for Heriqnaz to be able to earn more income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for forage to feed the livestock.

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jemma has been involved in agriculture for more than 10 years. She grows a variety of fruit trees - specifically apples, plums, apricots, and peaches - as well as cultivating tomatoes. She and her husband work hard together to bring in their harvest and they sell their produce at the local market. They live with their daughter and son in the village of Taperavan in the region of Ararat. Agriculture helps Jemma and her family to have a stable income and to cover the family's basic costs. 

Jemma has an old greenhouse that needs to be renovated. She has applied for this loan in order to renovate the greenhouse. This will enable her to cultivate more fruits and vegetables and gather more income.

This loan is very important for Jemma to cover her family's needs and ensure a better future for them.

loans.use: to pay for the essential repair and renovation of her greenhouse

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
Hakob is from the Syuniq region. He lives with his wife, mother, son and daughter.
Hakob is involved in agriculture and is the only breadwinner in the family. He keeps 10 sheep and cultivates wheat. Together with his wife, Hakob works hard to sustain his family.
He has applied for this loan to purchase 2 cows and forage for feeding them. He will get milk which he plans to use in cheese production. This will enable Hakob to earn more income.
The loan is very important for Hakob to earn more income and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and forage for feeding them.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a farmer. She owns a small piece of farmland where she grows pear and apricot trees. She lives with her husband and daughter in the town of Masis in the Ararat region. Together with her husband, Elena sells the harvested produce in the market and in this way earns some income. Agriculture is the only source of income for Elena and her family. 

Elena owns a greenhouse which is very old and which needs to be renovated. Elena has therefore applied for this loan to allow her to make essential repairs and renovations to the greenhouse. She will also use a portion of the loan to buy tomato seeds to plant.

The loan will help Elena to expand her agricultural activity and gather more income. With the help of this loan, she will be able to better cover the family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy tomato seeds and to renovate her greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy trees and insecticides for horticultural farming.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known market areas in Montserrado county, with her three children who are in school. She is a sixth grade student. For the past two years she has been selling fried calla, cold water and fish in her community. She enjoys her business because she makes more profit every day since she has more customers. She started this business by selling cold water from a wheelbarrow. She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, vita water, fish, pepper and oil for her business. Her plan is to build a house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, vita, fish, pepper and oil for her business.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primarily milk producing area. She has 4 children and has been farming for 15 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming is keeping dairy animals and having them be a source of income to the family for a long time. Earning from selling milk derives satisfaction. Her biggest challenge is a lack of modern training on how to keep dairy animals and to optimize their production. Animals on the farm have been given the names of Maridadi and Tausi.

Sally was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied that she learned of Juhudi from a friend after a marketing team from Juhudi visited Ndalat.  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session.  Her answer was: How to work in groups, acquire assets through group lending and repay the loan.

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, how will this loan benefit your family?, Sally replied there will be more income from milk sales due to increased production.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Sally owns the following: cow, and poultry but does not own pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva is from Kapan. A few months ago she opened her little shop where sells women and men’s clothing and shoes. Due to her kind attitude towards customers, Silva has already a lot of loyal customers. She started her business only few months ago and it needs some investment to be done. So, Silva has applied for this loan to purchase clothing and dressmaking supplies for her shop. She hopes that this loan will help her to satisfy her customer’s demand and stay competitive in the market.
Silva lives with her parents and brother and she hopes that with the help of this loan she will be able to sustain her family and make their life better.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and dressmaking supplies.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg has been involved in beekeeping for more than 15 years. He keeps 15 colonies of bees and gets high quality honey. Gevorg sells it in the local market and gets income, which helps him to sustain his family. Gevorg lives in Sisian with his wife, two daughters and a son.
Gevorg is the only breadwinner in the family and beekeeping helps him to have a stable income during the month. But it is very difficult for him to cover his family’s basic costs and at the same time save money for covering transportation costs. So he has applied for this loan to pay for transportation of honey to the market. The loan is also very important for Gevorg expand his business.
With the help of this loan he will also purchase 4 calves and forage for feeding them. This will help him to expand his agricultural activities and earn more income.

loans.use: to pay for transporting his honey, and purchase four calves and forage for feeding them.

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en:
Margarit is from Aghitu village in the Syunik region. She lives with her husband and is involved in agriculture. She keeps 15 chickens, cultivates potatoes, wheat and grows nut, apple and pear trees. Together with her husband, Margarit works hard to gather a good harvest and have a high income. But unfortunately her income is enough for covering only the family's basic needs. It is very difficult for Margarit to save money for transportation of the harvested products to the local market. She has applied for this loan to pay for transportation costs. This will enable her to take her harvested products to the local market, sell it and gather high income.
As agriculture is the only source of income for Margarit and her husband, she would like to expand that business. The other part of the loan Margarit will spend on purchasing 20 colonies of bees. This will enable her to gather honey and sell it.
The loan is very important for Margarit and her husband to make their life better.

loans.use: to pay for 20 colonies of bees and cover transportation costs of her fruit/vegetable harvests to market.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is 36 years old and lives in West Point in Montserrado County, which is noted for being the most commercial city in Liberia. She lives with her five children who are between 2 and 22 years old. Four of them are in school. For the past eight years Linda has been selling slippers in the local market. One of the problems she faces is the lack of capital. She enjoys the profit she makes every day. Having money for her expenses makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business. Her dream is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Avetiq

texts.en:
Avetiq is involved in agriculture. He keeps 3 cows, 5 sheep and 5 chickens. He also cultivates potatoes and sells it in the local markets. Avetiq lives with his wife and 17-year-old son. As Avetiq is the only breadwinner in the family, it is very important for him to expand his agricultural business. He has requested this loan to purchase 8 heifers. He plans to raise and fatten them and sell at a higher price. This will enable him to earn more income and continue the expansion of his business.
The loan is very important for Avetiq to sustain his family and ensure a better future for his son.

loans.use: to pay for 8 heifers.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome, age 49, operates a farm stand where she sells bananas. She has been involved in this business for 18 years and employs four staff members. Her farm business is located on fertile land and her primary customers are market traders. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insecurity within the area and banana theft. Salome and her husband have five grown children between the ages of 17 and 29 years old.

She will use her Kes 8,700 loan to buy a water tank, which will be used by her family members. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. 

Salome hopes that in the future she can improve her business by using more modern equipment on her farm.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for her family

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Vanadzor town with her husband. She has been in the food retail business over three years. Anahit opened her shop almost three years ago and trades with food products. 

Anahit is very kind woman and loves her shop very much. Now the shop needs some investment to be able to continue to be competitive in the local retail market. She has requested this loan to pay for supplies for the shop. This will enable her to satisfy her customers' needs and gather more income.

The loan is very important for Anahit to improve her living conditions and expand her shop.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for the shop

loans.name: Amalya

texts.en:
Amalya lives in Arevik village of Armavir region with her two sons. She cultivates tomatoes and also owns a grape orchard. Her sons help her to sell the harvest in the local markets. Agriculture is the only source of income for this family and it is very important for Amalya and her sons to gather a good harvest. 

Amalya would like to expand her agricultural business and gather more income. She has requested this loan to pay for three steers. The loan is very important for Amalya and her sons to get more income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for three steers

loans.name: Nazlu

texts.en:
Nazlu lives in Nalbandyan village of Armavir region with her two sons and together with them, Nazlu is involved in agriculture. 
They cultivate tomatoes and have a vineyard. Nazlu's sons sell the harvested products in the local markets and get some income. But unfortunately their vineyard is very old and needs to be renovated. 

Nazlu has applied for this loan to renovate their vineyard. This will enable them to gather grapes and sell them. 

Nazlu will use part of the loan for  purchasing two steers and forage for feeding them. She hopes that the expansion of her agricultural activities will give her an opportunity to earn a lot of income.

The loan is very important for Nazlu and her sons to be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for two steers, forage for feeding them, and renovation of the vineyard

loans.name: Arevshat

texts.en:
Arevshat is a teacher from Armavir region. He teaches at a local school and is involved in agriculture as well. He cultivates tomatoes, eggplants and cucumbers. He works hard to gather a good harvest and sell it in the local markets. 

Arevshat is very hardworking man and does his best to sustain his family. He lives with his wife, son and daughter in Mrgashat village of Armavir region.

Arevshat has applied for this loan to purchase fertilizer for the cultivation of vegetables. This will enable him to gather a good harvest to sell.

The loan is very important for Arevshat to cover his family's basic needs and ensure a better future for his family.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers

loans.name: Daysi Del Carmen

texts.es:
Deysi del Carmen de 27 años, casada con un hijo de dos años. Es originaria de Managua. Se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, responsable, buena paga el cual lo ha demostrado en los créditos anteriores con sus pagos en tiempo y forma. 
Ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de zapatos, desde hace 9 años, ubicado en unos de los mercados de la localidad. La rutina de Deysi es trabajar unas 10 horas diaria ofreciendo  productos como zapatos deportivos, tenis de cueros, sandalias de mujer hombres y niños. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabaja y surtir su negocio y aprovechar las buenas ventas porque inicia las  clases escolares, por la cual se obtiene una mayor demanda. Daysi del Carmen agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan le brinda a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Deysi del Carmen is 27 years old, married, and has a two year old son.  She is from Managua and is known for being a hardworking, responsible woman with a good credit history, as demonstrated by her previous loans.

She has been selling shoes in a local market for seven years.  Deysi works about 10 hours a day, offering products such as sports shoes, leather sneakers, and men’s, women’s, and children’s sandals.  She will use the money from this loan to stock her store and take advantage of the good sales because school is starting.  Daysi del Carmen is grateful to the Kiva lenders who help people of limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua to have a means of doing dignified work.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr: Femme de 39ans, Adjoa est mère de 03 enfants tous à l’école. En 2011, elle a démarré son activité de vente de tissus et pagnes à domicile et s’approvisionne généralement au Grand marché de Lomé. Elle sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des tissus et pagnes. Son objectif est de pouvoir épargner pour ouvrir une boutique et assurer un avenir meilleur à sa famille.
texts.en:
Adjoa is 39 years old. She has three children, all of whom go to school.

She sells fabric and pagnes from home. She started her business in 2011. Generally, she stocks up at the Grand Marché in Lomé.

She is seeking her first loan from WAGES in order to buy fabric and pagnes. Her goal is to save up so that she can open a shop and ensure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and pagnes

loans.name: Maqsim

texts.en:
Maqsim is from Lernagog village of Armavir region. He is involved in agriculture. His livestock currently includes two cows and 25 chickens. He gets milk and milk products and sells them in the local markets. But agriculture is the only source of income for Maqsim, so it is very difficult for him to cover his basic needs. He has applied for this loan to expand his livestock with two oxen. This will enable him to gather more income and improve his living conditions.

Maqsim is waiting for your support.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen and forage for feeding them

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 57 years old and lives in Gotocan Daku, Ozamiz City. She is a widow with two children. 

Monica has a general store that sells groceries. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan to buy groceries for her general store.

Monica has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, Monica hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, sacks of rice, dozens of cigarettes, noodles, kinds of kiddie foods, etc.

location.town: Ozamis-P2 Gotokan Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary  is a 45-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 20 years to 25 years. She describes herself to be an ambitious woman . She operates a a farmstand where she sells farm products. She has been involved in this business for 20 years and employs three staff members. Her business is located at a productive business area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Mary describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient water for irrigation. She will use the Kes 15,600 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her family members . She hopes that in the future, she will improve her farming business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary  is a 39-year-old married woman. She has two children, 2 years old and 13 years old. She describes herself to be honest and hardworking. She operates a farmstand where she sells bananas. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located at a business area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Rosemary describes her biggest business challenge to be the high transportation cost of the bananas. She will use the Kes 11,100 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her family members. Her business goal is to expand her business and employ people  within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her farming business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Amiri

texts.en:
Amiri is a 55-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 12 years to 27 years. She describes herself to be focused and hard-working. She operates a farmstand where she sells bananas. She has been involved in this business for 20 years and employs three staff members. Her business is located at a good viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Amiri describes her biggest business challenge to be outbreaks of pests which affect her crops. She will use the Kes 32,700 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her family members. Her business goal is to improve her business so as to double her profits  within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a married woman. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. She operates a grocery stall where she sells vegetables and fruits such as paw paw, onions, mangoes, pumpkins, oranges, and tomatoes. Her business is along a very busy road near a frequently busy business area. Her primary customers are local residents from the surrounding  area. She describes her business challenge as stiff competition within the area. Catherine will use her loan of 32,700 KES to buy a water tank which will be used by her family for household activities. She has a plan to expand her grocery store in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Kilimo

texts.en:
Kilimo earns an income by operating a retail business where she sells water to members of her community. She has been involved in this business for 17 years and employs four staff members. Her business is located in a fertile and productive business area and her primary customers are local residents and firms. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the poor road network to her business, causing some customers not to be able to access her business area. She also runs a farming business to earn additional income. She describes herself as a visionary woman. 

Kilimo and her husband have four children between the ages of 14 and 23 years.

She will use the Kes 8,700 loan to buy a water tank, which will be used as storage to serve the community with clean water. Her business goal is to improve her farming business within five years. 

She hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a 34 year old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 1 year old to 10 years old. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. Anna operates a farm stand where she sells farm products. She has been involved in this business for eight years and employs three staff members. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local residents from the region. She describes her biggest business challenge as the poor network of roads that lead to her farm business. She will use the 15,600 KES loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her family to complete household chores. Her business goal is to expand her business and thus increase production in the next five years. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is a 39-year-old married man with three children between the ages of 2 and 9. For the past four years, he has operated a motorcycle transport business and employs four staff members. Leonard's business is located in a busy town and his primary customers are local residents. He describes himself as a God-fearing and caring man. Leonard's biggest business challenge is the poor road network during rainy season. His goal is to buy a van to improve his mode of transportation within the next five years.

Leonard is requesting a 21,000 KES loan to buy a water tank for his family to use in their house and for household chores.  In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for his family to use

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 34-year-old married man. He has two children, ages 2 and 6 years old. He describes himself as an honest man. He operates a retail business selling household items such as baking flour, tea leaves, etc. His business is located along a busy road and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Joseph will use this 15,600 Kenyan shilling (KES) loan to buy a water tank to be used by his family for household chores. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that he will expand his business in the future. This is his second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited after taking out a previous loan of 20,000 KES which he managed to repay successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a 34-year-old married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 6 years. He describes himself to be a hardworking man.

Jacob operates a motorcycle where he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located along a busy area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. His business goal is to improve the business within 5 years. 

Jacob will use the 21,000 KES loan to buy a water tank which will be used by his family for household chores. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM after taking a loan of 20,000 KES which he managed to pay successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a 55-year-old married man. He has 8 children. He describes himself to be an optimistic man. He operates a farm where he sells maize, beans, paw paw and mangoes. He has been involved in this business for 30 years. His business is located in a conducive business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. His business goal is to improve the business within 5 years. He will use the 15,600 KES loan to buy a water tank which will be used by his ten family members on household chores. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 39-year-old married woman. She has 7 children. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. Her business is located in a local residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. Her business goal is to run multiple grocery stores within 5 years. She will use the 15,600 KES loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her family and also the extended family she lives with. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM after succesfully paying her first loan of 20,000 KES.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a 48 year old married woman. She has 6 children. She operates a business where she provides repair services to items such as wheelbarrows etc. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are the local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as having insufficient funds to improve the business. She will use the Kes 11,100 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her family for household activities . Her business goal is to run a welding repair retail store within the next 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM after taking a previous loan of Kes 20,000 which she managed to pay back successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en: Laxmi is 45 years-old .  She is married and has 2 children aged 25 and 18.  Many years ago, she established a grocery store.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has received and successfully repaid 1 loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Laxmi hopes to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley a small grocery stores is called a pasal and is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buys grocery items for resale

loans.name: Mira

texts.en: Mira is 35 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 16 and 15. Many years ago, she established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. Mira has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Mira plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Pius

texts.en: Pius is a 39-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from six years to fourteen years. He describes himself to be an ambitious man. He operates a farm where he sells tree seedlings. His business is located in a local residential area, and his primary customers are the local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving his business. He will use the Kes 11,100 loan to buy a water tank, which will be used by his five family members for household activities. His business goal is to expand his farming business within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM after taking out a previous loan of Kes 20,000.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 4 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be a focused woman. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. Her business is located within a busy urban area and her primary customers are local residents from the environment. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her business. 

Lilian will use the Kes 8,700 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her family on household chores. Her business goal is to buy more stock of clothes to sell within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM, having repaid  successfully a previous loan of Kes 70,000.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 40-year-old widowed woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 10 years to 23 years. She describes herself to be humble and a caring woman. She operates a grocery store  where she sells vegetables and fruit.  She also sells cereals which adds income. Her business is local and her primary customers are local residents from the environment. 

Dorcas describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the Kes 8,700 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her family on household chores. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 28-year-old married woman. She has two children, 4 and 7 years old. She describes herself to be hard-working. She operates a retail store where she sells household items such as salt, sugar, bread, etc. Her business is located near an urban busy area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Rose will use the Kes 8,700 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her family on household chores. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a water harvesting tank

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, age 59 and widowed, operates a retail store where she sells household items and snacks. Her business is located along a busy shopping centre  and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She has six children.

Mary will use her loan of Kes 41,500 to buy a water tank, which will be used by her family to maintain the household. Her business goal is to improve the business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her first loan of Kes 20,000 was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy a water harvesting tank

loans.name: Teresita De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresita una humilde señora, de 53 años de edad, originaria de Jinotepe, pero actualmente vive en León, soltera, madre de 4 hijos todos son independiente, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la  venta de tortillas y frijoles cosidos.  Inicio en su actividad laboral a la edad de 32 años, la cual buscaba una manera de sobrevivir y fue allí que se le vino a la idea de vender tortilla, la cual empezó con 5 libras de maíz para hacer tortillas, negocio que le genera muchas ganancias con el cual ha podido salir adelante con su familia, este ha sido su primer negocio, cuenta con el apoyo de su hija, sus expectativas es seguir creciendo en su negocio. Con el tiempo fue agregando la venta de frijoles, sus mismos clientes le solicitaban estos productos.
Ella sueña con lograr componer su humilde vivienda y mejorar la cocina que es donde prepara las tortillas y los frijoles. Está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar maíz, leña y frijoles. Ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a crecer en su negocio, incrementando sus ventas para obtener mejores ganancias, sus planes futuros es  establecer otro negocio como es el  de pulpería para que le genere más utilidades, una de sus metas próximas es pagar este crédito para luego volver a solicitar otro.
texts.en:
Teresita is a humble woman aged 53. She is originally from Jinotepe, but now lives in León, She is single and has four grown-up children. 

Teresita is a businesswoman, selling homemade tortillas and beans. She started this business aged 32 in order to make a living. The idea came to her of selling tortillas, which she began with 5 pounds of maize to make homemade tortillas. This business makes her a lot of money and has enabled her to move forwards with her family. This is her first business, and she is helped by her daughter. 

Her goal is to continue expanding her business. Over time she started to sell beans, because her own customers requested this.

Teresita dreams of fixing her humble home and improve the kitchen where she prepares her tortillas and beans. She needs the loan to buy maize, firewood and beans. She believes that this loan will help her to grow her business, increasing her sales so that she earns more. Her future plan is to set up another business such as a grocery store so that she can make more money. One of her next aims is to repay this loan and then request another.

loans.use: to buy maize, firewood and beans.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 39-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be a focused woman. She operates a mill where she grinds maize, millet and sorghum. She has been involved in this business for 16 years. Her business is located along a busy junction, and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 32,700 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy a water tank, which will be used by her six family members. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Veronica operates a retail store where she sells household items. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes herself is a humble woman. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She has four children.

She will use her Kes 8,700 loan to buy a water tank, which will be used by her family. Her business goal is to run a bigger retail shop within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She has successfully repaid her previous loan of Kes 20,000.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малике 47 лет. Она трудолюбивая женщина с прекрасной душой. Малика замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Малика решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес шитьем женской одежды, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки тканей и швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Malika is 47-year-old married mother of three. She is a hardworking woman with a good soul. 

Malika's husband has a very small salary, which cannot cover all of their family's necessary expenses. So, Malika decided to help her husband provide for their family. She took the course "Bring It On", organized by the Association of Business Women, and received a certificate. Now she is capable of successfully organizing her own business. 

Malika would like to start her own business sewing women's clothing because she has experience in this field. She plans to use the income to improve her family's standard of living. She is requesting a loan of 2500 som to purchase fabric and a sewing machine for her new business. She is waiting on your kindness!

loans.use: To buy fabrics and sewing machine for organizing new business

loans.name: Oliya

texts.ru:
Олия во второй раз берет кредит и надеется на поддержку со стороны Кива и кредиторов Кива. Первый заем она взяла с помощью Кива и кредиторов Кива для приобретения холодильника. Олия купила холодильник, который был нужен для хранения молочных продуктов и колбасных изделий. Также она увеличила ассортимент товара. Сейчас у нее имеются постоянные клиенты, еще увеличилось количество клиентов. 
В семье Олии пополнение, у нее на сегодняшний день пятеро детей. У них большая и дружная семья. В очередной раз Олия берет кредит для покупки продуктов питания. Она намерена увеличить оборот и ассортимент товара, чтобы клиенты без затруднений смогли купить необходимые товары.
texts.en:
Oliya is requesting a loan and counting on the support of Kiva and Kiva creditors for the second time. With her first Kiva loan, she purchased a refrigerator, which she needed to keep her milk products and sausages fresh. She was also able to improve her product assortment and her number of regular clients has greatly increased.

Oliya has a big, close-knit family with five children. This time Oliya is requesting a loan to purchase grocery products. She plans to increase her turnover and product assortment so that her clients can purchase all their essential products without difficulty.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products

loans.name: Alberto Lenin

texts.es:
Alberto Lenin de 28 años de edad, casado con un hijo de dos años, originario de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central de la región. En sus ratos libres aprovecha tiempo de calidad para pasear con su pequeño hijo. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar diseño gráfico.
Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos descartables y de plásticos como platos, vasos, cucharas, tenedores, chuchillos, descartables, panas, baldes, rompe cabezas. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos descartables, para que en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos. La rutina de Alberto es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias en su puesto de trabajo. Para brindar mejor atención a su clientela. Alberto Lenin agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Alberto Lenin is 28 years old, married and has a two year old son.  He is from Managua, located in the central zone of the region.  He likes to use his free time to spend quality time with his young son.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, he was not able to pursue university studies, but he would have liked to become a graphic designer.

Thanks to his entrepreneurial spirit and his desire to get ahead, he sells disposable plastic products such as plates, cups, spoons, forks, knives, cables, buckets, and puzzles.  He will use the money from this loan to stock his business so that he can have a better income in the near future.  Alberto works 10 hours a day at his post in order to provide better service to his customers.

Alberto Lenin is grateful to the Kiva lenders for providing people of limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua the opportunity to have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 32 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 14 and 6. In 2005, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Anita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Mahmad

texts.ru:
Махмад проживает в районе Вахш. Ему 50 лет. Он женатый человек. Махмад является отцом троих детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Махмад имеет средне - специальное образование, сварщик. 
Махмад занимается строительными работами по найму. По специальности Махмад занимается 7 лет. Кроме того он занимается купле-продажей угля. Этот вид бизнеса является основным источником дохода. Торговлей Махмад занимается в земельном участке свое брата, которую он арендует. В этой области он уже четыре года. Махмад берет кредит для покупки угля. В будущем он планирует открыть собственную торговую точку.
texts.en:
Mahmad is a 50-year-old resident of the Vakhsh region. He is married with three children. His wife is a homemaker. Mahmad attended a professional high school, where he was trained as a welder. He is employed in construction work. He has been using his trade for seven years.

Mahmad also works in coal sales, which provides his main source of income. He works off of land rented from his brother. He has been working in coal sales for four years now. He is requesting a loan to purchase coal. In the future, he plans to open his own retail outlet.

loans.use: to purchase coal

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as a humble woman. She operates a farm and sells maize and wheat. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of wheat and maize seeds. 

She will use this 32,700 Kenyan shilling loan to buy a water tank, which will be used by her five family members on household activities and by herself and her neighbors. She looks forward to expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy a water-harvesting tank.

loans.name: Glenda Marisol

texts.es: Glenda de 26 años de edad es una persona fuerte y dedicada que se entrega de lleno a realizar su trabajo, ella se dedica a la pesca artesanal, ella vive junto a su esposo y dos pequeños niños. Glenda pasa la mayoría del día en el lago, soportando largas horas de sol para poder obtener el sustento diario para su hogar, su esposo se dedica a la misma actividad y juntos se esfuerzan mucho. Glenda solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con la intención de mejorar las condiciones de su lancha que es tan vulnerable debido a las largas jornadas de pesca, y que poco a poco se ha ido deteriorando, lo que Glenda desea detener, ya que es esta su herramienta principal para elaborar su trabajo, logrando esto ella podrá  contar con una vida estable junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Glenda is 26 years old and is a strong, dedicated person who gives her all to her work.  She fishes and lives with her husband and two young children.  Glenda spends most of her time at the lake for hours at a time to be able to gather the household sustainment.  Her husband does the same type of work and they work hard together.

Glenda is asking for a loan through INTEGRAL so that she can make repairs to her boat that is so valuable for fishing, due to the long hours she spends working.  It has been deteriorating little by little and Glenda wants to stop it because it’s her main work tool.  By doing this she can have a stable life with her family.

loans.use: to repair her boat.

loans.name: Magrete

texts.en:
Magrete is a 37-year-old woman. She describes herself as a God-fearing, jovial and caring woman. She operates a poultry business where she sells chickens. Her business is located in a local residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years.

Magrete will use this 8,700 Kenyan shilling loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her family. This is her first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Biaziz

texts.ru: Биазиз женщина в возрасте 45 лет, она  замужем, имеет двоих детей.  Ее муж и старший сын работают мастерами по строительству домов.  Сама Биазиз занимается торговлей, она продает различные национальные ткани для пошива женской одежды.  Этим видом деятельности она начала заниматься пятнадцать лет назад. Биазиз начинала свой бизнес с малого оборота и товарооборот у нее был маленький но в 2006 году по совету своих знакомых она обратилась в организацию Арванд и решила взять кредит. С того года она стала постоянным клиентом этой организации. Биазиз планирует закупить несколько рулонов тканей и на полученный кредит хочет расширить свой бизнес.  Она благодарит организацию Арванд за постоянную финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Biaziz is a 45-year old woman, married, with two children. Her husband and eldest son work in house construction. Biaziz is a vendor. She sells various traditional ethnic fabrics for women’s clothing. She has been in this business for 15 years. Biaziz launched her business with a small capital, and she used have a small sales volume, but in 2006, upon the advice of some acquaintances, she turned to MDO Arvanda for a loan. Since then she has been a constant client of the organization. Biaziz plans to buy several rolls of fabric and expand her business  using  her loan. She thanks Arvand for continuous financial support.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabric.

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is a 25-year-old, single young man. He lives with his family in a small village near Tulkarem. His father is a broker, and the low income he earns isn't enough to cover all the family's needs.

For the past three years, Adham has been operating a cafe, which is located next to a local hospital. He serves customers with sandwiches and hot drinks, such as tea and coffee. Adham's cafe has a lot of customers and is the only one of its type near the hospital. This makes his project a profitable one. It is  the only source of income to him, but it needs more support to cover some costs in order to grow.

Adham is looking to expand his cafe to meet the increasing customers' demand. He is requesting a 1,100 USD Youth Loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing additional tables and chairs, and also to purchase more coffee and tea. This will improve Adham's cafe and increase his income positively.

Adham was photographed in his cafe.

loans.use: To purchase tables and chairs for use by customers in his cafe, and some more coffee and tea.

loans.name: Dawlat

texts.en:
Dawlat is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Dawlat is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother to one son who is 3 years old. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary that is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

Dawlat wants to improve her family's home living conditions, so she is requesting a $2,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the costs of painting the house and installing new windows. 

Taking this loan will offer to Dawlat and her family suitable home conditions, so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: To install new windows and paint the house.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud, who appears in the picture, had the photo taken in his cafe. He is a 20-year-old single young man. For the past three years Mahmoud has had a cafe. Customers come to his cafe to entertain themselves and have hot drinks such as coffee and tea. Mahmoud has a lot of loyal customers and friends who are available in his cafe daily, which makes his project a profitable one and the only source of income to him.

Mahmoud wants to improve the cafe's condition, so he is requesting a 1,500 USD Youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing new tables and a new collection of cups and trays. This will allow Mahmoud to expand his project, improve his business, and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase tables and chairs to expand the cafe

loans.name: Everardo

texts.es: Everardo de 29 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa y sus hijos . Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace muchos años, cultiva granos básicos como maíz, y frijol. Dicha actividad la repite año con año ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y lleva el pan de cada día a su hogar. Su sueño es mejorar  su calidad de vida  y la de su familia siempre ha deseado darles algo diferente, esto lo motiva a trabajar con más entusiasmo ya que solo con el trabajo logrará dar a su familia lo que tanto desea. Estas son razones por las que ha tomado la decisión de acercarse  a esta institución, INTEGRAL para solicitar crédito que le permita invertir en los insumos agrícolas como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, u otros y a parte el pago de una mano de obra para sus cultivos. Espera lograr su objetivo de dar a su familia lo que se merece y poder accesar a una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Everano, 29, lives in his own home with his wife and children.  He has been farming for many years, cultivating basic grains such as corn and beans.  He repeats this activity year after year, because this is his main source of income.  Through his farming, he earns a living and feeds his family.  Everano's main dream is to improve the quality of life for himself and his family.  He has always wanted to give his family something different, and this motivates him to work with more enthusiasm, because only with his work can he provide his family with what he so much wants to give them.  This is the reason why he approached this institution, INTEGRAL, to request a loan.  This loan will allow him to invest in farming supplies such as: seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, and other supplies.  He will also use part of the loan to pay for farmworkers.  He hopes to achieve his goals: to give his family what they deserve, and to be able to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as: seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, and other supplies, and to pay for farmworkers

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es: Luis de 28 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos, con quienes trabajan para salir adelante. Luis se dedica al  cultivo de frijoles y maíz, lo cual durante generaciones ha sido la actividad principal que les permite contar con el sustento diario. Luis solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario  para comprar: pesticidas y semillas de frijoles y maíz para sembrar. De esta forma José espera aumentar su producción de granos básicos para posteriormente vender  por  mayor. El préstamo otorgado por INTEGRAL, es muy importante para el crecimiento de su negocio y la estabilidad económica de su hogar, debido a que es la única fuente de ingreso que posee.
texts.en: Luis is 28 years old and lives with his parents and siblings with whom he works to get ahead.  Luis raises beans and corn which has been how they make a living for generations.  Luis is asking for this loan to buy pesticides, and bean and corn seed to plant.  In this way Jose expects to increase his production of basic grains and be able to sell in bulk.  This loan though INTEGRAL is very important for growing his business and for the financial stability of his household because it’s the only source of income he has.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Luis de 47 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos quienes se dedican a estudiar. Luis es mecánico y posee un pequeño taller automotriz en el que se dedica a reparar automóviles y así mismo a vender repuestos. Con el deseo de contar con todo lo necesario para su familia Luis también se dedica a la agricultura, alquilando un parcela en la que siembra maíz y maicillo que posteriormente comercializa con vecinos, personas particulares y así mismo en mercados y parques, su esposa le ayuda a esta actividad que tanto bien le hace a la economía del hogar. Luis solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para la compra de maíz y maicillo por mayor, con lo que Luis espera producir más granos básicos y de este modo aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en: Luis is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two children who attend school.  Luis is a mechanic and has a small workshop where he also sells auto parts.  He also farms so that he can provide for his family, and rents land where he raises corn and sorghum which he later sells to his neighbors, other people, and in markets and parks.  His wife helps him and this helps the household financial situation.  Luis is asking for this loan through INTEGRAL to buy corn and sorghum seeds in quantity, which he expects to use to produce more basic grains and increase his sales this way.

loans.use: to buy corn and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: Gonzalo de 56 años de edad, es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo y a suplir todas las necesidades de su hogar, él vive junto a su esposa quien le brinda la ayuda necesaria en el negocio. Gonzalo es un hombre con mucha experiencia ya que la adquirió de su padre, él trabaja como agricultor sembrando maíz y frijoles en su propio terreno, mismo lugar en el que vive junto a su familia. Gonzalo solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de semillas  de frijoles y maíz y así aumentar el porcentaje de ganancias, también para realizar un mejor trabajo Gonzalo invertirá en la compra de pesticidas, palas y piochas para elaborar un mejor trabajo, en donde  pueda realizar mayor cantidad de siembra y así mismo mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is 56 years old and dedicated to his work and to providing for all of his household’s needs.  He lives with his wife and has much experience that he got from his father.  He farms and raises corn and beans on his own land, where he lives with his wife.

Gonzalo is asking for a loan through INTEGRAL that he will use to buy bean and corn seed so he can increase his income.  He will also buy pesticides, shovels, and spades to work better so he can better his crops and also improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.es: Edgardo de 45 años de edad, reside en una pequeña parcela junto a su esposa y dos hijos quienes estudian y así mismo aprenden el oficio familiar. Edgardo se encarga de crías ganado vacuno para posteriormente comercializar, así mismo realiza la siembra de maíz, frijoles y caña de la cual elaboran la azúcar y diferentes bebidas. Los granos básicos los vende con diferentes almacenes de cereales y así mismo en tiendas y mercados,  por lo que es un trabajo bastante estable. Edgardo con la ilusión de mejorar sus ganancias y así mismo mejorar su negocio, solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el cual pueda comprar semillas para sembrar, pesticidas, abono y herramientas para realizar la siembra, así m ismo para comprar más ganando.
texts.en: Edgardo is 45 years old and lives on a small parcel of land with his wife and two children who attend school.  They are also learning the family business.  Edgardo raises and sells cattle.  He also raises corn, beans, and sugar cane that he uses to make sugar and different drinks.  He sells the basic grains to different grain suppliers, stores, and markets and it’s very stable work.  Edgardo wants to increase his earnings and improve his business, so he is asking for this loan through INTEGRAL, to buy seeds, pesticides, compost and tools to plant his crops.  He also wants to buy more livestock.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Shoimardon

texts.ru: Шоимардону 52 года. Он со своей семьей проживает в Шахритусском районе. У него пятеро детей. Жена Шоимардона занимается продажей лепешек на базаре. А Шоимардон обеспечивает семью за счет прибыли полученной с купли-продажи крупно-рогатого скота. Он занимается животноводческой деятельностью уже 5 лет и является знатоком своего дела. Сейчас гдавная мечта Шоимардона - купить легковой автомобиль. С целью реализации своей мечты он запрашивает кредит на сумму 1000 долларов для купли-продажи крупно-рогатого скота. За счет полученной прибыли он надеется реализовать свою мечту.
texts.en: Shoirmadon is 52 years old. He lives with his family in the Shahrituz region. He has five children. His wife sells pita bread at the market. Shoirmadon provides for his family by buying and reselling cattle. He has been raising animals for five years and excels at his work. At present Shoirmadon’s main dream is to buy a car. In order to achieve his dream, he is requesting a loan in the amout tof 1,000 USD in order to buy cattle for later resale. He hopes to earn enough revenues to realize his dream.

loans.use: to buy cattle for later resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost, corn seeds, and herbicides.

loans.name: Osiris Yesmin

texts.es: Osiris, tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Osiris tiene una pulpería desde hace 4 años y vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, como arroz, maíz, frijoles, café, sal, azúcar, manteca, churros, condimentos, pastillas, carnes, lácteos etc.  Ella es una mujer emprendedora siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en la pulpería y surtir de carnes, lácteos, granos básicos y otros abarrotes. Su propósito es hacer crecer el negocio. Tiene como meta obtener ingresos para ayudar a sus hijos con el estudio.
texts.en:
Osiris, age 31, is single because she is a widow. She has three children and lives in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.

Osiris has a convenience store that she started four years ago. She sells basic household products such as rice, corn, beans, coffee, salt, sugar, lard, snacks, condiments, medicines, meats, dairy goods, and other items. Osiris is an enterprising woman who has always worked in the retail trade. She decided to request a loan so that she can invest in her store by restocking it with meat, dairy products, basic grains, and other grocery items. Her objective is to grow her business.

Osiris also has a goal of generating income to help her children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy meat, dairy products, basic grains, and other grocery items.

loans.name: Tajikan

texts.ru: Тажикан проживает в селе Жерге-Тал на юге Кыргызстана. Как и многие семьи в сельской местности, Тажикан откармливает скот, начав этот бизнес в 2000 году с суммы 16,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, Тажикан в своем хозяйстве имеет 4 головы дойных коров и 20 голов овец; продажа молока и молочных продуктов  и откорм скота позволяет получать около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Тажикан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух дойных коров для увеличения выручки от продажи молока. Доходы Тажикан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, чтобы иметь возможность оплатить ремонт дома.
texts.en: Tajikan lives in the village of Jerge-tal in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  As do many families in a rural area, Tajikan fattens livestock, having started this business in the year 2000 with a sum of 16,000 som (KGS).  Today, Tajikan has 4 milk cows and 20 sheep in her holdings; milk and milk product sales and fattening of livestock allow her to earn around 12,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further grow her business Tajikan turned to the company "Bai-Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 135,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of two milk cows to increase earnings from milk sales.  Tajikan plans to invest her earnings into further increasing her livestock count in order to be able to pay for home repairs.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es:
ROSA DEL CARMEN tiene 35 años de edad es madre soltera tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y la madre en La Magdalena Perteneciente a Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

 ROSA DEL CARMEN trabaja cómo auxiliar de servicios en un domicilio. Solicita el dinero para gastos de medicina, alimentación. Con la ayuda del crédito mejorara la condición de salud de la madre. Las compras las realizará cada mes en Chimbo y cada semana en la magdalena. El sueño es poder varreglar la casa.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es poder darles a los hijos una mejor educación. En el tiempo libre le gusta leer tejer en la casa.
texts.en:
Rosa del Carmen is 35 years old and a single mother with two children. She and her children live with her mother in La Magdalena, which is part of Chimbo in Bolívar Province.

Rosa del Carmen works as an assistant at a residential home. She is requesting money for expenses, such as medicine and food. With this loan, she will be able improve her mother’s health condition. Her purchases are conducted both monthly in Chimbo and weekly in La Magdalena. Rosa’s dream is to make repairs to her house.

The challenges she faces include being able to provide her children a good education. In her free time, Rosa enjoys reading and knitting at home.

loans.use: to pay for food and medicine.

loans.name: Giselle De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Giselle de los Ángeles de 33 años de edad, casada con dos hijos, menores de 7, 1 años de edad. Es originaria de Managua. Lugar que está ubicado en la zona central de la región.  En sus ratos libres le gusta mucho escucha música, elaborar  platos típicos para sus hijos como el gallo pinto. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria pero le hubiera gustado ser  una maestra titulada.
Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosméticos, desde hace 10 años ubicado en unos de los mercados de la localidad de la región. La rutina de Giselle es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos como: vanidades, polvo compacto, sobras, lápiz labias, cremas faciales, perfumes, rubor, delineador. Giselle agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Giselle de los Ángeles is 33 years old, married, and has two young children (ages 7 and 1). She is originally from Managua, a place that is located in the central part of the region. In her free time, she enjoys listing to music and preparing traditional dishes for her children, such as Nicaraguan rice and beans. Unfortunately, due to the lack of financial resources, she was not able to finish her university degree. She would have liked to become a teacher.

Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and her drive to succeed, Giselle has been earning her living by selling cosmetics. She has been doing this for the past 10 years at one of the local markets in the region. Her routine consists of working approximately 10 hours each day by offering products such as compacts, pressed powders, eye shadows, lip pencils, facial crèmes, perfumes, blush, and eye liner.

Giselle is grateful for the assistance that the Kiva lenders provide to people who have limited resources and are from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they can make a decent living.

loans.use: to buy compacts, pressed powders, eye shadows, lip pencils, facial crèmes, perfumes, blush, and eye liners.

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es:
Rosa, solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, abono, herbicidas, pago de alquiler de terreno y comprar dos vacas, esto le ayudara a que realice un nuevo trabajo en la agricultura para poder tener una cosecha que le de ingresos para la alimentación de la familia. 
Con el préstamo anterior su trabajo se beneficio en el cultivo, pues obtuvo buena cosecha la que tambien sirvió para alimento y para poder generar ventas, sus producciones han mejorado, cultivando cada año y luchando con su familia por salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa is requesting a loan so that she can buy farming supplies (including compost and herbicides), pay the rent on the farmland, and to purchase two cows. This will enable her to begin her new farming projects so that she can have a harvest that will generate income to help provide food for her family.

With her previous loan, Rosa saw benefits in her work. Her crops generated a good harvest, which helped provide food and generated good sales. The production from her crops improves each year, so she strives to help her family move forward.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, pay the rent of her farmland, and to purchase two cows.

loans.name: Justiniano

texts.es:
Justiniano, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para comprar repuestos de bicicletas, repuestos para algunos coches, y comprar herramientas para el taller, parches, juego de frenos, pedales, asientos, y reparar algunos coches, esto ayudara para que el taller tenga más capacidad y que Justiniano se mantenga trabajando.
El efecto que le dio el préstamo anterior fue positivo, ya que realizo algunas reparaciones de bicicletas y compro los repuestos que le permitieron realizar su trabajo, además realiza viajes para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Justiniano decided to request a new loan so that he can buy bicycle parts, a few automobile parts, and some tools for his workshop. These purchases will include patches, brake sets, pedals, and seats so that he can also repair a few cars. This loan will allow his workshop to have more capacity and enable Justiniano to keep working.

The effect of his previous loan was positive. He was able to make a few bicycle repairs, so purchasing the parts allowed him to complete the work. Justiniano also made delivery trips to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy patches, brake sets, pedals, and seats.

loans.name: Abaz

texts.en:
Abaz is a 47-years-old Iraqi man. He is married and the father of three children.

Abaz is the owner of a bakery where the typical flat bread is prepared and purchased by families in dozens at a time for all meals of the day. The bread is a simple dough, stretched out on a small pillow which is also used for throwing the thin raw dough into the fire, making it stick to the side of the hot cave to bake in just a few minutes. 

Abaz has been the owner of this shop for a year now, and would like to renew the shop by painting it, ensuring it meets the continuously updated requirements set by government standards for food production facilities.     

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to paint the walls of the bakery.

loans.name: Chnwr's Group

texts.en:
Chnwr is a 32 years old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of two children.

She now has 5 years experience with the small home-based sewing and tailoring business activity. She successfully repaid her previous Kiva loan which she used to buy an oversewing machine to be able to provide more variety in the services she can provide to her customers. She would now like to concentrate on improving her own work conditions, making her work hours more pleasant.     

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to renew her work area and create a better work environment for her sewing work.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra de 36 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su grupo familiar su esposo y sus hijos. Ella se dedica  a la agricultura de granos básicos como maíz, frijol. Esta actividad la realiza  junto a su esposo y es así como logran llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.  Sandra es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora  y responsable.  Siempre se ha  dedicado a la agricultura por lo que  conoce muy bien la manera de hacer esta activada. Cada año realiza esta actividad de la cual vende una parte de su cosecha y la otra la deja para consumo. Es así como poco a poco va saliendo adelante y dando a su familia el alimento básico. Vive en condiciones muy humildes junto con su familia, esto la hace agarrar más fuerzas para seguir luchando por un futuro diferente. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de  insumos agrícolas como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. Es así como  se gana la vida y lleva el pan de cada día a su hogar. Espera que  este año la cosecha sea favorable y logre cumplir su sueño.
texts.en: Sandra is 36 years old and lives in her own house along with her family, her husband and children. She works farming staple grains such as corn and beans. She does this work with her husband and this is how they put bread on the table everyday. Sandra is an enterprising, hardworking, and responsible woman. She has always worked in farming because she knows very well how to do this work. Every year she sells part of her harvest and keeps the rest for consumption. In this way, she is slowly moving forward and giving her family their staples. She lives in very humble circumstances with her family, and this motivates her to keep fighting for a different future. She has made the decision to request a loan from INTEGRAL to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, etc. This is how she makes a living and puts bread on the table. She hopes that there will be a good harvest this year and that she will be able to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as: seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, etc

loans.name: Benito

texts.es: Benito habita junto a su compañera de viada en casa de su propiedad. El se dedica a la crianza de pollos. Es un hombre muy emprendedor y sobre todo trabajador.
