No deja pasar ninguna oportunidad de negocio, lo más importante que realiza su trabajo con mucha dedicación y amor lo cual hace que las personas le tenga confianza y lo prefieran cada día más. Es muy importante mencionar que estas actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingresos por lo que trabaja muy duro para poder seguir recibiendo los frutos que hasta el momento ha recibido. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL ya que ha estado pensando en la forma de hacer crecer sus ingresos y ha llegado a la conclusión que esta sería una buena decisión . El crédito lo solicita para invertir  en la crianza de pollos es decir para comprar insumos como: concentrado, desparasitantes, vitaminas, etc. para mantenerlos en buenas condiciones. De esta forma espera mejorar sus ganancias y poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida, diferentes a las que  por el momento tienen.
texts.en: Benito lives with his life partner in his own house. He works raising chickens. He is a very enterprising man and, above all, hardworking. No business opportunity passes him by. The most important thing is that he does his work with dedication and love, making people trust and prefer him more every day. It is very important to mention that this work is his principal source of income and so he keeps working very hard to be able to keep receiving the fruits of his labor. He has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL because he has been thinking about how to increase his income and has reached the conclusion that it would be a good decision. The loan will be invested in raising chickens by buying supplies such as: concentrate, parasite remover, vitamins, etc, to keep the chickens in good condition. In this way, he hopes to improve his income and to give his family better conditions, different to how they live now.

loans.use: to invest in raising chickens by buying supplies such as: concentrate, parasite removers, vitamins, etc.

loans.name: Marvin Alonso

texts.es:
Marvin Alonso de 46 años de edad, casado con tres hijos de 12, 21,28 de los cuales dos están bajo su responsabilidad y estudian. Él es originario es originario de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central del país. En sus ratos libre le gusta salir al cine, o ver partidos de futbol. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico a él le hubiera gustado cursar una carrera universitaria, y ser ingeniero automotriz.
Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica la venta de repuestos de vehículos. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto, su rutina es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias en su negocio. Ya que hasta  la fecha ha sido su medio de vida y la de sus familia. El objetivo del financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar repuestos de vehículos como llantas, neumáticos, motor válvulas, chisperos, para que un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Marvin Alonso agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a las personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Marvin Alonso is 46 years old, married, and has three children of 12, 21, and 28 years old, 2 of whom are still under his care and are studying. He is from Managua, a place in the central zone of the country. In his spare time he likes to go to the movies or watch soccer games. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, he was not able to study at university, but he would have liked to have taken a degree and been an automotive engineer.
Thanks to his spirit and his desire to be successful, he works selling vehicle parts. He likes this work very much and he works 10 hours a day in his business. To date, this has been his livelihood and that of his family. The goal of this loan is to invest in business capital and to buy vehicle parts such as rims, tires, motor valves, and spark plugs so that, in the near future, he will have a better income. Marvin Alonso is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to people who have scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so they have dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in business capital and to supply his business selling vehicle parts such as rims, tires,  engine valves, and spark plugs.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Mirian de 50 años de edad, casada con tres hijos mayores, vive en la ciudad de Managua. Lugar que está ubicada en la zona sur de León. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora  responsables, la cual ha tenido que luchar duro en la vida para salir adelante. 
Gracias a su espíritu  y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica la venta de cuajada de su casa y de forma ambulante. La rutina diaria de Mirian  es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias bajo el intenso sol, con una pana de unos 20 kg, la cual recorre las calles de su comunidad. Pero actividad que la realiza con muchas ganas ya que ha sido su forma de darles el sustento a sus hijos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de cuajada,  para que un futuro no muy lejano poder aumentar sus ingresos. Mirian agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Miriam, age 50, is married and has three grown children.  She lives in the city of Managua south of the León area.  She is known for being a hard-working and responsible woman.  She has had to work hard in her life in order to get ahead.

It is thanks to her spirit and her great desire to get ahead that she has a business selling curds at her house and in an itinerant manner.  Miriam’s daily routine is working ten hours a day under the hot sun with a basket of about 20 kilograms, and she travels the streets of her community.  However, she does this business activity with a lot of desire because it has been the way to support her children.

The loan is to invest working capital and stock her business of buying and selling curds.  She will do this in order to be able to increase her income in the near future.

Miriam is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help they give to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a decent way of earning a living.

loans.use: to buy curds to sell.

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Диловар житель района Гончи города Истаравшан. Ему 44 года. Он женат, отец четверых детей. Диловар единственный кормилец семьи. Он обеспечивает семью за счет купли продажи скота, а также выращивает плодовые деревья. Диловар очень энергичный человек и с интересом занимается своим делом. Он хочет расширить свою деятельность и получить хорошую прибыль. С этой целью он запрашивает кредит на сумму 2000 долларов для купли-продажи крупно-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Dilovar is a resident of the Gonchi neighborhood in the city of Istaravshan.  He is 44 years old.  He is married and is the father of four children.  Dilovar is the sole provider in his family.  He provides for his family by buying and selling livestock and also grows fruit trees.  Dilovar is an energetic person and does his job with interest.  He would like to expand his business and earn a good profit.  With this goal, he is asking for a loan of 2000 dollars to purchase and resell cattle.

loans.use: to purchase and sell cattle

loans.name: Mercidia

texts.es: Mercidia tiene 61 años de edad casada con seis hijos 30,32,38,40,43 y 44 de edad los cuales todos trabajan ella es propietaria de un negocio que consiste en la venta de mercadería en general como es la venta de ropa nueva, calzados, cosméticos entre otros ella trabaja en compañía de uno de sus hijo que sale a vender a los departamentos,  mercidia con muchos esfuerzos y deseo de superación ha logrado sobresalir en algunos obstáculos que se le han presentado en el transcurso de la vida, ella vende sus productos de forma ambulante y da al contado y al crédito, los cuales recupera semanal y quincenal ella desea continuar creciendo en su negocio y con la ayuda de financiamiento continuara invirtiendo. El financiamiento es para la compra de pantalones camisas, faldas, camisetas, trajes para niños y niñas y ropa de vestir, artículos escolares como: lápiz, cuadernos, borradores, mochilas entre otros
texts.en:
Mercidia, age 61, is married and has six children, ages 30, 32, 38, 40, 43, and 44.  All of them work.  She has a business selling general merchandise like new clothes, shoes, and cosmetics, among others.  She works with one of her children, who goes out to sell in the departments.

With great effort and the desire to succeed, Mercidia has managed to overcome obstacles she has encountered in her life.  She sells her products in an itinerant manner.  She sells for cash and for credit, and she collects weekly and biweekly.  

She wishes to continue growing in her business, and with the help of the loan she will continue investing.  The loan is to buy pants, shirts, skirts, t-shirts, outfits for boys and girls, and other clothing.  She will also buy school supplies like pencils, notebooks, erasers, and backpacks, among others.

loans.use: to buy clothes and school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Частный предприниматель Айнура  родилась в 1974 году в селе Совет-Сай ,Ала-Букинского района,Джалал-Абатской области (южная часть Кыргызстана). Образование среднее,замужем,мать 5-х детей. Айнура  уже имеет достаточный опыт в сфере сельского хозяства и в животноводстве. Характеризуется как примерная,целеустремленная,трудолюбивая и знающая специфики своего бизнеса. Обращается в наш банк в первый раз и запрашиваемая сумма микрокредита 60 000 KGS,получив микрокредит заемщик планирует использовать на покупку скота и дальнейщая увеличения поголовья скота.В данное время в хозяйстве имеет 2 КРС  и 25 МРС.
texts.en: Private entrepreneur Ainura was born in 1974 in Sovet-say village in the Ala-Bukinsky area, in the Djalal-Abatskaya region (south part of Kyrgyzstan).  She has a high school education, is married and is the mother of 5 children.  Ainura already has sufficient experience in the area of farming and livestock.  She is exacting, goal oriented, hardworking and knows the details of her business.  She is turning to our bank for the first time and is asking for a microcredit loan of 60,000 KGS; after receiving a loan the borrower plans to use it to purchase livestock and further increase her livestock headcount.  Today her holdings include 2 heads of cattle and 25 heads of small horned livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Qobiljon

texts.ru: Кобилчон житель Шахритусского района. Ему 36 лет. У него трое детей. Он со своей супругой в собственном магазине продает продукты питания и одежды. Кобилчон занимается этим делом уже 7 лет. Чтобы увеличить товарооборот и получить хорошую прибыль, Кобилчон обратился за кредитом. Он просит кредит на сумму 1050 долларов для закупа продуктов питания и одежды с целью увеличения ассортимента товара своего магазина.
texts.en:
Qobiljon is a 36-year-old resident of the Shahrituz region. He has three children. 

Qobiljon and his wife sell groceries and clothing from their own store. He has been in this business for seven years. Now he has turned to a loan to improve his store's product line and increase his profit. He is requesting a loan of 1050 dollars to purchase groceries and clothing items in order to provide a better assortment of products in his store.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products and clothing in order to provide a better assortment of products in his store

loans.name: Sétonougbo

texts.fr: Père de 02 enfants dont 01 à l’école, sétonougbo est détenteur d’un cyber café à Lomé. Il sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des ordinateurs, des ventilateurs pour son cyber. Avec le bénéfice, il veut ouvrir un cyber annexe et bien entretenir la famille.
texts.en: A father of two children, one of whom attends school, Sétonougbo is the owner of a cyber cafe in Lomé. He is seeking his first loan to buy computers and fans for his cyber cafe. With the profits, he would like to open an additional cyber cafe and take good care of his family.

loans.use: To buy computers and fans.

loans.name: Romualde

texts.fr: Romualde est une jeune dame de 25ans qui exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente des produits de mercerie. Mariée à un enseignant, elle n’a pas encore d’enfant en charge. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et vend à ses clients de parts et d’autres de la ville. Pour mieux les satisfaire, elle fait un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. Avec les bénéfices qu’elle va réaliser, elle veut ouvrir une boutique et assurer un avenir radieux à ses enfants. Elle est dans le domaine il y a 03ans.
texts.en: Romualde is a young woman aged 25 who runs an income-generating activity selling dressmaking items. Married to a teacher, she does not have any children in her care yet. She gets her supplies at the grand market in Lomé and sells them to her customers in various parts of the city. To better satisfy them, she is on her first loan with WAGES to buy more merchandise. With the profits that she will realize, she wants to open a shop and ensure a bright future for her children. She has been in this business for three years.

loans.use: To buy dressmaking items.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en: Kumba a 55-year-old woman who lives in West Point, which is one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County.  She did not attend school.  She is married and has three children between the ages of 21 and 30.  All of her children are living on their own. For the past 11 years she has been selling water by the sack (water is sold in small plastic bags instead of bottles).  Sometimes it is difficult, but most of the times she makes a  profit.  She uses the profit to sustain her family.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more water by the sack for her business.  She hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more water by the sack for her business

loans.name: Faby

texts.en: Faby lives in Darbouze, Haiti in an area with erratic access to electricity. He already has a small boutique that sells motorcycle parts but is looking to expand his business by becoming an EarthSpark clean energy entrepreneur. He is seeking a loan of so that he can be set up with an EarthSpark “Business in a Bag” a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills. He would like to sell solar desk lamps as well as the Recho Gaz Blan and the Recho Mirak cookstoves. The Recho Gaz Blan is a kerosene cookstove and the Recho Mirak is a charcoal-efficient cookstove, both of which help the environment by reducing the need for charcoal. He wants to sell EarthSpark products because he appreciates the products and the initiative as a whole. He would like to improve access to EarthSpark products and help light up his community.

loans.use: to pay for stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Auguste

texts.en:
Auguste lives in Chantal, in the South Department of Haiti. He has had a grocery store for 17 years that sells food supplies. He has recently decided to start selling EarthSpark clean energy products to expand his current business. 

With a Kiva loan, Auguste will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills. Auguste would like to sell solar energy desk lamps with mobile phone charging capability. He wants to sell clean energy products because he needs to grow up his grocery in such a way that he could earn more money to help his family.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business

loans.name: Rosane

texts.en: Thanks to the support of Kiva funders, Rosane is applying for a new loan! After being funded on Kiva, Rosane received a “business in a bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.  She used this “business in a bag” to launch a clean energy entrepreneurship with EarthSpark. She sold out of her products so quickly that she has paid off her loan and is now coming back to us for another loan. This time, she would like to double her business. With this money, she will continue to sell solar desk lamps and charcoal-efficient stoves on a rent-to-own basis in her community.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business

loans.name: Saphinia

texts.en: Saphinia lives in Les Cayes, the third largest city in Haiti. Even though she has a university degree she is currently working with EarthSpark as contractor. She would now like to launch her first business by becoming an EarthSpark Clean Energy Entreprenuer. With a Kiva loan, Saphinia will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills. She is looking for a loan to purchase stock for solar energy desk lamps with mobile phone charging capability because this is the product most in demand in her area. She wants to sell EarthSpark products because she appreciates the products and the initiative as a whole. She would like to improve access to EarthSpark products and help light up his community.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business

loans.name: Juline

texts.en:
Thanks to the support of Kiva lenders, Juline was able to successfully launch her clean energy business in Les Anglais, Haiti last month! She chose to sell solar powered desk lamps and solar light bulbs on a rent-to-own basis in her community. Using a rent-to-own approach gives her customers access to solar lighting without having to worry about the upfront costs. The customer pays back the amount of money they would normally spend on kerosene each night and once the rent-to-own term is finished not only do they have a cleaner, healthier source of lighting but they cut down on their energy costs as well. 

Juline is looking for another loan to expand her business. She would like to buy more solar powered desk lamps as she has a list of customers waiting for them!

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Частный предприниматель Гульмира  родилась в 1984 году в селе Совет-Сай ,Ала-Букинского района,Джалал-Абатской области (южная часть Кыргызстана). Образование среднее,замужем,мать 3-х детей. Гульмира   имеет хороший опыт в сфере сельского хозяйства и в животноводстве. Характеризуется как примерная,целеустремленная,трудолюбивая,старательная,умеет вести бизнес и вкладывать деньги. Обращается в наш банк в первый раз и запрашиваемая сумма микрокредита 30 000 сомов,полученный микрокредит заемщик планирует использовать на покупку скота и дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.В данное время в хозяйстве имеется наличность 1 КРС и 10 МРС .
texts.en: Gulmira is an entrepreneur born in 1984 in the village of Soviet-Say of the Ala-Buka Region, Jalal-Abat province (in the south of Kyrgyzstan). She has finished secondary school, is married and has three children. Gulmira has extensive experience in farming and animal husbandry. She is said to be reliable, goal-oriented, hard-working, and diligent. She knows how to manage her business and invest funds. She is applying to our bank for the first time, requesting a microloan of 30,000 KGS. She plans to use this loan to buy more cattle and continue to increase the headcount. At present her farm includes one head of cattle and 10 heads of small livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Cheche Jesus 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Eden habite dans la région d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Il a dirigé son commerce de Produits divers pendant les 7 dernières années. Il voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans le commerce. 

Il va acheter des objets divers tels que des chaussures, des vêtements, des produits cosmétiques et d'autres, son entreprise a grandi un peu depuis son dernier prêt, ce qui a contribué à soutenir leurs enfants de plus en motiver d'autres membres dans le groupe Cheche Jesus.
texts.en:
Eden lives in an area of Haiti where electricity is rare and water is very limited. He has run his business selling various items for seven years. He would like to use this loan to invest in his business.

He is going to buy various items such as shoes, clothing, cosmetics, and other articles. His business has grown a little bit since his last loan, and this has contributed to his providing for his children, and has also motivated the other members of the Cheche Jesus group.

loans.use: to invest in buying shoes, clothing, cosmetics, and more

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en: Ganzorig, 39 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. He has been running a transportation business using his own truck for twenty-one years. His two children both go to high school. Even though he owns a house on his plot of land, his family doesn’t live there because the house’s low pressure heating system is broken and over the years the house has been deteriorating and thus needs some serious repair. Therefore he is requesting a loan of 6,700,000 MNT to purchase necessary construction and insulation materials. The main repair work includes but is not limited to the installment of a heating system, interior decoration, roof insulation and the installment of vacuum windows. As a result the family will be able to live in a comfortable and warm place. Most importantly, the renovated house won’t lose its heat, which will reduce the consumption of coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 67 years old and married with 6 children.

Estelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy more nipa to sell.

Estelita has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) for 12 years and also earns an income from buying and selling firewood.

Estelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more nipa to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making rice cake.

loans.name: Jovelien

texts.en:
Jovelien is 33 years old and married with two children.  For thirteen years she has run a general store in the Philippines.  Jovelien also earns an income from selling ice cream.  Jovelien is requesting 15,000 PHP to buy shampoo, canned goods, soap, and other products to sell.

Jovelien aspires to expand her business and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items for her general store (i.e. shampoo, canned goods, soap).

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda.  Her previous loan was a big help for her business and for the education of her children.  She has a food stall and also does direct selling of electronic loading (airtime for cell phones).  She is running her business for seven years now and it keeps growing.  She is working hard to provide income for her family.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy electronic load from different local networks, such as Globe, Smart and Sun.  Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Imelda dreams to expand her business even more and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for electronic load from different local networks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more copras (dried coconut meat) to resell.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell, like spices, noodles, soft drinks, and soap for her general store.

Asuncion has been in this business for 15 years. She also earns more income through pig fattening.

Asuncion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell, like spices, noodles, soft drinks, and soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 42 years old, married with three children, all of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Marilyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for three years; in the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell for her business.

loans.name: Mekar Jadi Pondoan Group

texts.en:
Because the price of feed is expensive, the Mekar Jadi Pondoan Group continue to borrow loans from MUK. They purchased piglets from the previous profits. 

Ni Nyoman will use her loan to purchase piglets and feed. From the previous profits, she purchased two piglets and from this loan she will purchase two more piglets. She will keep them for six months for fattening. She hopes this time she can sell the pigs for a high price. She will continue to renovate her house with the profits.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more copra to resell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline. Her previous loan was a big help to her laundry business and to pay for everyday expenses, and she is very thankful for that. Her business keeps on growing. She also owns a room for rent for additional income. She and her husband work hard to provide income for their family. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy supplies like detergent, fabric softener, and other materials used in the business. She will also use the money towards the maintenance of her room for rent. The profits will definitely help her to sustain her business and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Evangeline hopes that her businesses will be strong and stable. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies like detergent, fabric softener, and other materials used in her laundry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell in her food/retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Crestita

texts.en:
Crestita is 58 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Crestita runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 18,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, sugar, milk, canned goods, etc..

Crestita has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future, Crestita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, sugar, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Omid

texts.ru:
Омид 1961 года рождения.   Он женат и имеет детей.   С самого  детства Омид  разводит скот, этому делу его научили родители.  Дома со своей семьей  он содержит коз и овец.  Жена и дети помогают в этом бизнесе. Сейчас скот намного дешевле, весной скот подорожает поэтому Омид хочет купить несколько коз и овец до весны.  Этот бизнес ему очень нравится и он старается развивать его.  Омид не учился и у него нету образования хотя очень этого хотел,  с раннего детство у него в семье были финансовые проблемы, поэтому он очень хочет чтобы его дети учились и работали в будущем по профессии.  
  На полученный кредит Омид хочет купить коз и овец и расширить свое стадо. Омид благодарит организацию Кива за финансовую поддержку и помощь.
texts.en:
Omid was born in 1961.  He is married and has a family.  He has been raising livestock since his childhood and learned this occupation from his parents. He raises goats and sheep at home with his family.  His wife and children help him with this business.

The price of livestock is quite low right now, but it will get higher in the spring.  This is why Omid would like to buy a few goats and sheep before the spring.  

Omid truly enjoys the business he is involved in, and he is trying hard to develop it.  

Although he did not go to school and has no formal education, Omid really wishes he did.  Ever since he was a child, his family always had financial difficulties.  For this reason, he really hopes that his children will study, so that they can get good jobs in the future.

Omid intends to use his loan to buy goats and sheep, in order to expand his herd.  He thanks Kiva for its financial support and assistance.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
This is Flora; she previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy needed materials for beaded bracelets and necklaces. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She and her husband work hand-in-hand in providing income for their family.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan to buy beads, crochet materials, and other things needed in making bracelets, necklaces, and crocheted items. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs, and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Flora hopes to expand her business, and dreams of having a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from studiyng the fellowship Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for beads, crochet materials, and other things needed in making bracelets, necklaces and crocheted items.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a coffee shop.  Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soap, coffee, eggs, spices, canned goods, and other products for her general store business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like soap, coffee, eggs, spices, canned goods, and other products

loans.name: Sari Indah Badung Group

texts.en:
The Sari Indah Badung Group continues its loaning. In addition to developing the business by buying piglets, the group also used the money to buy pig feed and fix the pigs' cages. From the previous loan, they could also save for venture capital. The new loan will be used to develop the business. All members of the group are feeling very helped by these loans because they can develop their business and generate revenues to improve the welfare of their families.

Ni Nyoman will buy two super-quality piglets and feed. She plans to keep the pigs for fattening. She will also purchase a sow with her own money. Ni Nyoman thanks MUK, KIVA, and the lenders because of their supports towards developing the business and improving the welfare of the group's families.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy groceries like shampoo, soft drinks, soap, spices, and other products to sell through her general store.

Gina has been in this business for 8 years. Gina earns more income from pig fattening.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy groceries like shampoo, soft drinks, soap, spices, and other products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell at her food/retail shop

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 53-year-old married woman from Maribojoc, Bohol. She has two adult children.  

Teresita operates a sari-sari (variety) store business and a small eatery where she sells home-cooked meals. In her store, she also sells commodities like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, soaps and toiletries. She has been in the sari-sari store business for ten years. 

She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more merchandise to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, casseroles, vegetables, seasoning and meat. 

In the future, Teresita would like to expand her business by investing in other business ventures to support her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, casseroles, vegetables, seasoning and meat.

loans.name: Haitgul

texts.ru: Хаитгул жительница Шахритусского района. Ей 63 года. Ее муж на данный момент находится за пределами страны на заработках. Хаитгул трудолюбивая женщина. Она уже 9 лет обеспечивает семью занимаясь купле-продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Чтобы расширить свой бизнес и улучшить условия проживания, Хаитгул обратилась за кредитом. Она просит кредит в размере 1000 долларов для закупа бычков. Хаитгул закупает скот в дальнейшем для продажи с наценкой.
texts.en: Haitgul is a resident of the Shahrituz region.  She is 63 years old.  Right now, her husband is abroad earning money.  Haitgul is a hardworking woman.  She has been supporting her family for 9 years by buying and selling livestock.  In order to expand her business and improve her living conditions, Haitgul is asking for a loan.  She is asking for a 1000 dollar loan to purchase bulls.  Haitgul purchases livestock to sell at a mark up.

loans.use: to purchase bulls

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 31 years old, married, and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines.

Marites requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her store, like soap, noodles, toothpaste and bread. Marites has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns income by buying and selling charcoal.

Marites aspires to save enough money so she could afford to finish the education of her children, to college level.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell, like soap, noodles, toothpaste, and bread

loans.name: Zebogul

texts.ru:
Зебогул во второй раз кредитуется в Хумо. В первый раз она получила кредит с помощью Кива и кредиторов Кива для увеличения поголовья скота. На сегодняшний день у Зебогул две коровы и три быка. Она смогла увеличить поголовья скота. Кроме того она занялась птицеводством. 
В этот раз Зебогул берет кредит для птицеводства, чтобы расширить этот вид деятельности.
texts.en:
This is Zebogul's second time borrowing from Humo.  The first time she received a loan with the help of Kiva and Kiva lenders in order to increase her livestock count.  Today, Zebogul has two cows and three bulls.  She was able to increase her livestock count.  She also started raising poultry.  

This time Zebogul is taking out a loan for raising poultry in order to increase this business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and chicken feed and create appropriate conditions for poultry farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cosmetics, lotions and creams, for her beauty parlor business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, 33, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Roberto, her business partner, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, is working hard to sustain their family’s everyday expenses at this time.

Evelyn is in the services category as her business. She works by the project, as someone who is in the landscaping business. She is being referred by her friends and family to someone who needs landscaping. This business is not regular. There are times when she doesn't have customers. That’s why she is looking for another business for additional income. If she does have regular customers, she has an income of PHP 50,000 a month.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy materials and equipment like rakes, shovels, brooms, edgers and other items needed in landscaping. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Evelyn hopes that her children will finish their studies and dreams of having more projects and customers. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials and equipment needed in landscaping.

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.ru:
Гулрухсору 32 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Детям 5 и 7 лет. Гулрухсор должна обеспечивать детей в основном сама, так как ее муж уехал в Российскую Федерацию, и является трудовым мигрантом. Гулрухсор хочет организовать свой бизнес для получения дохода и обеспечения детей. 
С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. От данного курса она получила много новых информаций, и теперь она в состоянии организовать свой бизнес. Она планирует организовать бизнес скотоводством, так как ее место жительства весьма благополучна для скотоводства. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и новыми технологиями. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulruhsor is 32 years old.  She is married and is raising 2 children.  The children are 5 and 7 years old.  Gulruhsor needs to provide for her children mostly alone, because her husband moved to the Russian Federation and is a migrant laborer.  Gulruhsor would like to start her own business to earn an income and provide for her children.  

With this goal she has taken the course "Get Ahead," organized by the National Association of Business Women of Tajikistan and earned a certificate.  She received a lot of new information from this course and is now able to start her own business.  She plans to start a livestock business as her place of residence is well located for raising livestock.  She plans to use her income to provide her children with a good education and new technology.  She is asking for a loan of 4000 somoni to purchase livestock in order to start a new business.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start new business

loans.name: Nasriddin

texts.ru:
Насриддин житель района А. Чоми. Он женатый молодой человек. Ему 31 год. У него двое детей. Жена Насриддина работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Насриддин имеет высшее экономическое образование. 
Более шести лет Насриддин работает бухгалтером. Также параллельно он занимается животноводством. Этот вид деятельности не мешает ему работать по профессии. Насриддин имеет богатый опыт в области животноводства. У него дома имеются необходимые условия для разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он берет кредит для закупа коров и телят. В будущем Насриддин планирует расширить свою деятельность, также построить парник для выращивания помидоров и огурцов.
texts.en:
Nasriddin is a resident of the A. Jomi area.  He is a married young man.  He is 31 years old.  He has two children.  Nasriddin's wife works on a farm.  Nasriddin has a college economics education.  

For more than six years Nasriddin has been working as an accountant.  In parallel he also raises livestock.  This business does not prevent him from working in his profession.  Nasriddin has a lot of experience in the livestock area.  His house has the necessary conditions for raising cattle.  He is taking out a loan to purchase cows and calves.  In the future Nasriddin plans to expand his business and build a greenhouse for growing tomatoes and cucumbers.

loans.use: to purchase cows and calves

loans.name: Mahmadi

texts.ru:
Махмади житель района Хуросон. Ему 50 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Он живет с женой и сыном. Махмади по профессии учитель. Он более тридцать лет работает в средней школе. Кроме того он занимается растениеводством. Он арендует небольшой участок земли, где сеет пшеницу. Этим видом деятельности он занимается пятнадцать лет. 
Махмади берет кредит для посева пшеницы.
texts.en:
Mahmadi is a resident of the Khuroson region.  He is 50 years old.  He is married.  He has five children.  He lives with his wife and son.  Mahmadi is a teacher by profession.  He has been working at a high school for over 30 years.  In addition, he is a farmer.  He rents a small plot of land where he plants wheat.  He has been in this business for fifteen years.

Mahmadi is taking out a loan to plant wheat.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sharofuddin

texts.ru: Шарофуддин проживает в районе Хуросон. Ему 34 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Шарофуддин пять лет проработал по профессии, экономистом. На сегодняшний день он занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. В этой области у него имеется богатый опыт. С детства Шарофуддин занимался растениеводством, он всегда помогал своему отцу. Шарофуддин берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений и топлива.
texts.en: Sharofuddin lives in the Khuroson region.  He is 34 years old.  He is married.  He has two children.  Sharofuddin worked for five years in his profession as an economist.  Today, he plants crops.  He has a lot of experience in this area.  Sharofuddin has been farming since childhood, he always helped his father.  Sharofuddin is taking out a loan to purchase fertilizer and fuel.

loans.use: to plant vegetables

loans.name: Kayirkan

texts.ru: Кайыркан со своей семьей живет в одном из высокогорных сел Кыргызстана – селе Совет-Сай,что что на юге страны. Ей 45 лет, воспитывает 1 сына который учится в школе. Кайыркан в качестве источника дохода для семьи занимается животноводством. Начатое со стартовой суммы в 1,500 сом (KGS)в 1990 году на сегодняшний день хозяйство насчитывает 2 дойные коровы, 15 голов овец, 3 бычка, и приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и перепродажи скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кайыркан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Кайыркан планирует вложить в увеличение хозяйства и построить сарай. В стратегические планы семьи Кайыркан входит, покупка машины и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Kayirkan and her family live in the village of Sovet-Say, in the high mountains of southern Kyrgyzstan.  She is 45 years old and the mother of one son who attends school.

In order to provide a source of income for her family, Kayirkan got involved in animal farming.  She started in this business in 1990 with an initial capital of 1,500 som (KGS).  She now owns two dairy cows, 15 sheep and three young bulls, and she makes close to 12,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk and the resale of livestock.

In order to further develop her farming business, Kayirkan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy more livestock.  She is planning to reinvest her revenues from this loan into the expansion of her business and the construction of a barn.  The family's long term plans include buying a car and repairing their house.

loans.use: to buy some cattle.

loans.name: Alimurod

texts.ru:
Алимурод житель города Хуросон. Ему 54 года. Он женатый мужчина. У него пятеро детей. Двое его сыновей находятся на заработках за рубежом. Алимурод имеет среднее образование. 
Алимурод занимается животноводством. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Сейчас у него имеются два быка и одна корова. Алимурод берет кредит для закупа бычков с целью увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Alimurod lives in the city of Khuroson.  He is 54 years old.  He is a married man.  He has five children.  Two of his sons are abroad earning money.  Alimurod has a high school education.

Alimurod raises livestock.  He earns money by raising cattle.  Right now his has two bulls and one cow.  Alimurod is taking out a loan to purchase bulls in order to increase his livestock count.

loans.use: to buy bulls in order to increase his livestock count

loans.name: Muqadamkhon

texts.ru:
Мукадамхон жительница города Исфара. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. 
Мукадамхон занимается торговлей на рынке, где арендует торговую точку. Она занимается оптовой продажей сухофруктов. В этой области она пять лет. Мукадамхон берет кредит для закупа сухофруктов (кураги и яблок).
texts.en:
Muqadamkhon is a resident of the city of Isfara.  She is married.  She has two children.  Her husband is earning money in the Russian Federation. 

Muqadamkhon sells at the market, where she rents a sales location.  She sells dried fruit.  She has been working in this area for five years.  Muqadamkhon is taking out a loan to purchase dried fruit (apricots and apples).

loans.use: to purchase dried fruit (apricots and apples)

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is 29 years old and married with 2 children.

She earns a living by selling flowering plants in the Philippines. Rima is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizers, seedlings, and other materials for her business.

Rima has been selling flowering plants for 4 years and also earns additional income from electronic re-loading.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seedlings, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a buffalo for a livestock and dairy business

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna, 55, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ceferino, self-employed, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household as they operate the business. At this time, she and her husband are working hard to provide income to their family.

Edna operates an internet café business. Services like this become a need as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She has customers who need to rent computers for business purposes, like writing a resume and office documentation, as well as customers who would just love to surf the net and visit social network sites. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in profit every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting an 18,000-PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Edna dreams that her computer shop will be known and hopes that her children will finish their studies so they can have a grand vacation. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en: Albina is a 42-year-old married woman from Cortes, Bohol. She has 4 children. The youngest is 10, while the oldest is 20. She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, and soaps. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional merchandise, like soft drinks, biscuits, soaps, and beverages. In the future, Albina would like to expand her business to support her family.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise like soft drinks, biscuits, soaps, and beverages

loans.name: Paula

texts.en: Paula is 59 years old and lives in the community of Panglao, Bohol. She is married with two adult children. She is engaged in multiple small businesses. She cooks snack food like deep-fried banana in caramelized sugar and siakoy (fried dough sprinkled with sugar). She also grows vegetables and raises hogs. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy flour, fertilizer, and feed. In the future, Paula would like to expand her business and continue saving for old age.

loans.use: to buy flour, fertilizer, and feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grocery items for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories for a mobile-phone business.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
Florinda is 62 years old and married with eight children.

Florinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a genral store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like spices, canned goods, soap, noodles, etc.

Florinda has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 21 years, and also earns an income from buying and selling rice. Florinda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Florinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like spices, canned goods, soap, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Milona

texts.en:
This is Milona. Her previous loan was a big help in her business and she is very thankful. She was able to buy more products for her direct selling business. She has been in this business for twenty years now and it is growing. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and products such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. More items to sell will result in a larger profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Milona hopes for a continued growth in her business and dreams of having a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and products such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Charisse Ann

texts.en:
Charisse is a 28-year-old woman from Baclayon, Bohol, Philippines. She has four young children, two boys and two girls. She has engaged in a candle making business for 6 years now and earns 13,000PHP monthly. This is her only source of income.
Charisse is requesting a loan to buy paraffin wax, wicks and containers. Thes are the materials used to make candles. With this loan, she will be able to buy these materials and continue making her candles to sell in her local community and in church.
In the future, Charisse hopes to expand her business and be profitable. She wants to send all her children in school so they have a better future.

loans.use: to buy paraffin wax, wicks, and  containers to make candles.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en: Albina is a 54-year-old married woman from Cortes, Bohol, Philippines. She has 2 grown children. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store .She has been in the sari-sari- store business for 10 years. She sells merchandise like noodles, soaps, beverages and condiments. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy additional inventory to sell like canned goods, rice and soft drinks. In the future, Albina would like expand her business to support her family as well as have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell like canned goods, rice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy embroidery materials such as beads, thread and embroidery frames.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Hezhar

texts.en:
Hezhar is a young Iraqi man, 27 years old, single, and as an unmarried man lives with his family.
He is the owner of a small, well located shop which sells all kinds of mobile phone accessories, including such important items as batteries and chargers - which are often destroyed here due to power fluctuations. He also sells items very popular among Iraqi teens, such as colorful covers and little phone decorations.

The shop is very nicely organized, but with a little a work it could be better set up to allow Hezhar to carry more supplies, and display his current items in a way more visible for his customers. Hezhar would like to improve the shop, and to be able to pay for the work he requested a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 2400 USD.

Hezhar is under 30 and as such qualifies for a youth loan.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to renovate and improve his shop to allow him to better display his merchandise.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida. Her previous loan was a big help to her business and she was able to buy all the supplies that she needed. She has been in this business for thirty years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies needed in growing pineapples and bananas. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. Shee looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Zenaida hopes for continued growth in her business and dreams of a prosperous life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for  fertilizer and other farm supplies needed in growing pineapple and banana.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
This is Lorena. Her previous loan was a big help in her variety store and she was able to buy all the needed grocery items for her store. She has been in this business for ten years now. She also has a bakery for additional income. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family expenses.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and their children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lorena hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her variety store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more eggs to resell.

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en: Ambrose is a 44-year-old married man. He has 3 children that range in age from 6 to 20 years. He describes himself as a God fearing and focused man. He operates a business where he provides landscaping services to customers. He has been involved in this business for 9 years. His business is located within an urban area and his primary customers are financial institutions, business owners and residents within the area. He describes his biggest business challenge as being insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy landscaping materials. His business goal is to expand his business to the western province within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to educate his children with the profits generated from the business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy landscaping materials.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en: Peris is a 35-year-old married woman. She has 3 children that range in age from 6 to 12 years old. She describes herself to be visionary woman. She operates a retail business where she sells second hand furniture.  She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located within a very busy rural area and her primary customers are business people. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to increase her stock of second hand furniture to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children. This is her second loan, after successfully paying back a previous loan of Kes 20,000.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of second hand furniture to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Sabiha

texts.en:
One year has gone by and Sabiha continues to be the busy seamstress and tailor she was when RI staff visited her for her previous loan. She is now 48 years old, and continues to set a great example for her 5 children whom she raises alone since her husband died.

With the loan she previously took from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq she was able to purchase an embroidery machine, allowing her to provide her customers with a greater variety of services. She would now like to make some improvements to her work area, to better organize her supplies and have a more pleasant time while she spends hours at her machines. To improve her work area she is now taking a loan in the amount of 2100 USD.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to improve her work are and better organize her supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth. Her previous loan was a big help to her business and she is very thankful. She has been in this business for a year now and it continues to grow. She now sells salted eggs along with the regular eggs. She and her husband are working hard to continuously provide income for their family.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy more eggs and salted eggs. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth hopes to have more customers and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She dreams to give her children a good and quality education all by the grace of God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional eggs and salted eggs needed for her business.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a 55-year-old married woman. She has 3 children that range in age from 4 to 10 years old. She describes herself to be honest and a focused woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a competitive business environment and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as being lack of capital for business expansion. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy clothes to sell. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will run a boutique. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.en:
Marcosa is a 56-year-old married woman from Cortes, Bohol, Philippines. She has five children. She has engaged in a basket weaving business for 30 years now and earns 2,000 PHP per month. This is the source of her income and covers the needs of her family.
Marcosa is requesting a loan to buy buri (native palm), wicker, nito vine and bamboo. These are the materials used in making baskets. Through the help of this loan, she will be able to buy the materials needed in making baskets. In the future, Marcosa hopes to expand her business to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy buri (native palm), wicker, nito vine and bamboo to make baskets.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is 43 years old. He lives in the Lanchkhuti District with his wife and 2 children. Avtandil requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The only source of income for the family is a monthly pension from Avtandil’s small income working as a distributor. It is 250 Laris per month. It is hardly enough to supply food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Avtandil requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Avtandil will renovate his car. After the car is renovated, he plans to serve local people as a taxi driver and earn income. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to renovate his car and work as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou works hard to support her family. She is single and has a sari-sari store, or variety store, in the Philippines.

Analou requested a 16000 PHPloan through NWTF to purchase more shampoo, sardines and other groceries.

She has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Analou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more shampoo, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred is a 30-year-old married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 6 months to 9 years. She describes herself as an honest and faithful woman. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located within a busy town  and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge as delay of payment from customers. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy cosmetics for her beauty salon. Her business goal is to run a hairdressing school within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM after having paid off a loan of 20,000 KES previously successfully.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann, 22, is a married woman from Cortes, Bohol. She has 2 young children. The older child is 4, while the younger is 4 months old. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells basic commodities like beverages, noodles, canned goods and soft drinks. She has been in the sari-sari business for 4 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more noodles, canned goods, soaps and other items to sell. In the future, Mary Ann would like to expand her business to support her family and save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more noodles, canned goods, soaps and other items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing materials.

loans.name: Bejan

texts.en:
Bejan is 27 years old. He lives in Baghdati District with wife, mother, brother, sister and an infant daughter. Bejan requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but he had no success. His loan request was rejected every time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow, 2 buffalos and a hectare of agricultural land, where maize is grown. Besides, Bejan owns a vineyard, where 700 wine trees are grown. It is hardly enough to pay for food for the family. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Bejan requested loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Bejan will purchase building materials. After purchasing building materials, he plans to build a greenhouse. He will sow cucumbers there and sell them locally at a good price. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a 39-year-old married woman from Cortes, Bohol. She has four young children. The youngest child is an infant while the oldest is 8 years old. 

She is engaged in a basket weaving business. She makes baskets made of buri (native palm), nito vine and bamboo. She has been in basket weaving for 6 years now and this is the source of her income. Her husband is a hollow block maker and laborer in their community.

She requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy buri (native palm), wicker, nito vine and bamboo. Through this loan, she will be able to buy these materials and start making her baskets.

In the future, Teresa would like to expand her business to support her family.

loans.use: to buy buri (native palm), wicker, nito vine and bamboo

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is a 32-year-old married woman with 4 children. She lives in Cortes, Bohol. She is engaged in a basket weaving business. She makes baskets made of buri (native palm). She has been in the basket weaving business for 7 years. Her husband is a laborer.

She requested a loan of 2,000 PHP to buy materials for basket weaving like nito (native palm) and wicker (a hard-woven fiber formed into a rigid material, usually used for baskets or furniture). In the future, Marjorie would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to save for her children's  schooling.

loans.use: to buy materials like nito (native palm) and wicker (a hard-woven fiber formed into a rigid material, usually used for baskets or furniture)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grocery items for grocery selling business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 43-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be dedicated to her work. She operates a retail shop where she sells cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located within a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more cosmetics to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more eggs to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Kulankash

texts.en: Kulankash is 33 years old now, married and blessed with one child. He has been doing animal sales for the last seven years, making a monthly income of about KES 20,000. He has applied for his second loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase more goats and sheep for fattening and resale for profit. The anticipated profits will help expand his capital. His future dream is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more goats and sheep for fattening and resale for profit.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy vegetables for a vegetable-selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Akram

texts.en: Akram is a 26-year-old married man with three children who lives with his lovely family in the city of Taiz, Yemen. He has a diploma. Akram is a very hardworking and active man. Since he was a student, he has worked in a cafeteria. He saved a good amount of money and got married. He wants to now to have his own cafeteria. He wants to improve his life. He is now in the last steps of opening his cafeteria, but he needs to buy all the cafeteria's needs: fruit, mixers, fridge,  glasses, tables ,chairs, and so on. Therefore, he asked for a youth loan in the amount of 350,000 YER. He hopes that this business will help him to improve his family's living standards and open a saving account with AMB.

loans.use: to purchase items for his food stall.

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en: Priscah is a 34-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as an innovative woman. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located within an area conducive to business and her primary customers are local residents of the area. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell.

loans.name: Nery

texts.en:
This is Nery, a resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is married to Ronald and a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nery operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php20,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Nery hopes to have a good life and dreams of expanding her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samwel is 38 years old, married, and supports a family of three. He has been running a taxi business for the last three years making a monthly income of about KES 12,000. He has applied for his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase spare parts to help service his car. The anticipated profits will help in the maintenance of the car and to finally buy another car. His future dream is business success and improved living standards.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to help service his car.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Alicia requested a 25000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of bread, snack foods, soft drinks and other products to sell

Alicia has been in this business for 10 years now, and she earns additional income from food vending.

Alicia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and her food vending business.

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of bread, snack foods, soft drinks and other products to sell.

loans.name: Adah

texts.en:
Adah, 53, is from Nyalenda in Kisumu city, which is located in the western part of Kenya; she is married and has one child. She runs a posho mill and the business is doing well.

She has applied for a business loan to purchase more maize and millet for milling. With these purchases, she will be able to get enough income to provide for her family.

With the additional income, she will be able to meet the basic needs for her family and expand her business with enough assorted grains for milling.

loans.use: To buy more grains to sell at the posho mill.

loans.name: Sergo

texts.en:
Sergo is 51 years old. He lives in Batumi with his mother-in-law, his wife and their 15-year-old son, who goes to the local school. Sergo’s mother-in-law is a pensioner.
