Sergo’s economic activity is his newly-started business - a bakery where traditional Georgian bread is baked. Sergo sells the bread from the bakery. 

He has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for business expansion, but he hasn't had any success because of lack of experience in his business. Sergo has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Sergo will purchase flour and wood for baking bread. He will bake more bread and sell for a good price. This will increase his sales volume. This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase flour and wood for baking bread.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married and works hard to support her family. She has a rice milling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and a general store business. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional rice milling for her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional rice milling for her business.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a 30-year-old married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself as a dedicated woman. She operates a retail store where she sells cell phones and their accessories. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are along a busy street. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy mobile phones and phone accessories. Her business goal is to run another retail shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children with the profits generated. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM after taking a previous loan of Kes 50,000, which she managed to pay successfully.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and phone accessories.

loans.name: Teofie

texts.en: Teofie is a 39-year-old married man from Cortes, Bohol. A father of a 9-year-old daughter, he is engaged in a candle-making business. He has been in this business for 2 years. Aside from making candles, he also raises hogs. Teofie requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy materials for candle-making, like wax, bamboo sticks and thread, and to buy feed for the pigs. In the future, Teofie would like to expand his business to support his family.

loans.use: to buy materials for candle making, like wax, bamboo sticks and thread, and also feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Amabel

texts.en:
Amabel works hard to support 2 children. She is married and has a buy-and-sell flower business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of an emergency.

Amabel is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Senaithy

texts.en: Senaithy is a 37 year old single woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as a God-fearing woman. She operates a retail store where she sells grains such as maize, beans and animal feed. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are from this densely populated area. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy maize to sell. Her business goal is to sell cereals at wholesale within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will build a house. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previously, she took out a loan of 20,000 KES and paid it off successfully.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 36-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with between 4 and 20 years old. She describes herself as hard working. She operates a retail business where she sells curios. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located at a viable business area and she has a large number of customers. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the 15,000 KES loan to buy curios to sell. Her business goal is to be a supplier of curios within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy curios to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 53 years old and married to Albert. She comes from Kakamega County in the western part of Kenya. She is blessed with five children who go to school.

Mary operates a food kiosk which sells cereals and stuff like tomatoes, onions and many other small vegetables. She has been doing this business for about 15 years and makes a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

She is borrowing her third loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more cereals and assorted vegetables to sell. She will reinvest the anticipated profit into the business and use part of it to pay school fees. She dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman in the region.

loans.use: to purchase cereals and kale to sell.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 37 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Andrew has been working hard to manage his bar, where he sells drinks such as soda and beer. 

To help expand his business, Andrew has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beer, spirits and wine to sell. This will help Andrew to generate greater profits and pay the school fees for his children. Andrew hopes that in the future he will be able to start supplying groceries in the neighboring towns. 

Andrew is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which primarily serves small entrepreneurs such as Andrew who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more beer, spirits and wine to sell.

loans.name: Kanini

texts.en: Kanini is a married woman. She describes herself as a humble and visionary woman. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services. Her business is located in a residential business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy cosmetics. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence (who is with one of her sons in the picture) is a 35-year-old married woman. She has four children, ranging from 9 to 19 years old. She describes herself as honest and humble. 

Florence operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea, snacks, etc. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a residential business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds for improving her business. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell. Her business goal is to run a restaurant within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 43 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Rose has been working hard to manage her stationary shop, where she sells stationary items. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a photocopier, books, box files and chalk to increase her sales. This will help Rose to generate greater profits and pay the school fees for her children. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a wholesale shop. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs such as Rose who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier, books, box files and chalk to increase sales.

loans.name: Wilbroad

texts.en:
Wilbroad is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children, 4 of whom are currently in school. For the past 5 years, Wilbroad has been working hard to manage his retail store, which sells eggs and plastic items. 

To help expand his business, Wilbroad has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more plastic items that will increase his sales, helping Wilbroad to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. Wilbroad hopes that in the future he will be able to to have a well stocked and established store. 

Wilbroad is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Wilbroad who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more plastic items to sell.

loans.name: Alberto Manuel

texts.es: Alberto de 25 años de edad tiene un negocio de peluquería enfocada en caballeros, que inició desde hace 8 años, cuando cortando el cabello gratis a sus amigos y familiares, fue adquiriendo su propia clientela, y también mucha experiencia, con la que hoy trabaja y le permite generar sus propios ingresos. Su actividad la desarrolla en su domicilio, ubicado al suroccidente de la ciudad, desde los lunes hasta los domingos, en un horario que inicia a  las 10 de la mañana y termina a las 8 de la noche y muchas veces hasta más tarde, pues se ajusta a las necesidades e intereses de su clientela. Como toda la comunidad de su barrio lo conoce y la de los alrededores también, son muchos los clientes que llegan a su negocio para acceder a sus servicios y muchas veces se siente sin las condiciones  para responderles, por eso su meta mas adelante es tener un local adecuado y continuar apoyando a su madre, que es manicurista y también está en el sector de la belleza estética. Teniendo toda esta clientela, decidió emprender un nuevo servicio de juegos y tiene un equipo de Play Station, que le genera unos ingresos más y que cada día atrae clientes jóvenes del servicios de peluquería también. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  una maquina para cortar cabello, pues es la herramienta con la cual se desempeña y necesita tener la mejor y con ello lograr mayor calidad en su desempeño, asi mismo comprará un nuevo equipo de juegos play station, con el fin de aumentar el potencial de atenciaon de su clientela y aumentar cada vez mas sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Alberto is 25 years old and owns a barber shop, which he set up eight years ago. By cutting his friends and family's hair for free he acquired his own clientèle as well as a lot of experience, which allows him to work and generate his own income. He carries out this activity in his own home, located to the south west of the city, from Monday to Sunday, starting at 10 a.m. and finishing at 8 p.m. or often later, as he adapts to his customers' needs.

As the whole of his neighbourhood and the surrounding ones know him, he has many customers who come to his business to enjoy his services but he often feels he cannot cater to their needs adequately. For this reason, his goal in to have a suitable locale in the future and to continue supporting his mother, who is a manicurist and also works in the aesthetic beauty sector. Having such a large clientèle, Alberto decided to set up a new games service and he has a Play Station games console, which brings in more income and young customers to his barber's shop.

At present he is requesting a loan, his first loan cycle with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which he will buy an electric hair trimmer to cut hair, as this is the tool he uses to work and he needs to have a better one to improve the quality of his service. Also, he will buy a new Play Station games console in order to increase the potential of his customer services and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy an electric hair trimmer

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio vive en casa propia y está ubicada en la zona de Obiso Bosque de la Ciudad de la Paz.

Sergio, trabajaba en una entidad pública de donde se jubiló y percibe una renta;  está separado de la esposa,  los hijos ya son mayores de edad, el crédito que solicita es para refaccionar la fachada de su vivienda. 

El sueño de Sergio fue ver profesionales a sus hijos lo cual se hizo realidad

Es la sexta vez con IMPRO  y la quinta vez que es parte de KIVA,
texts.en:
Sergio lives in his own house, which is in the Obiso Bosque area of the city of La Paz.

Serio worked for a public entity from which he retired and gets a pension.  He is separated from his wife, and his children are now adults.

The loan he is requesting is to refurbish the front of his house.

Serio’s dream was to see his children become professionals, which did become a reality.

This is the sixth time with IMPRO and the fifth time as part of Kiva.

loans.use: to refurbish the front of his house.

loans.name: Bery's Group

texts.en:
Bery is a young Iraqi woman. She is 27 years old, divorced and the mother of one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Bery is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate the income needed to support herself and her child, while her family also helps.

Bery has 7 years experience with her home-based sewing work, which she continuously tries to improve to make sure she can offer the best services for her customers. In the past, she took out a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq which she used to make her work area a little nicer and customer friendly and she was also able to purchase some quality raw materials to work with. Having successfully repaid her loan, she is now taking a new loan which she would like to use to replace her sewing machine.  

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor and are therefore unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for her protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to replace her sewing machine.

loans.name: Jose Olmedo

texts.es:
JOSE OLMEDO tiene 37 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijas, vive con la conyugue y los hijas en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

JOSE OLMEDO es dueño de unas cabinas telefónicas. Solicita el crédito para comprar un refrigerador. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para el bar.

La Compra la realizará en la ciudad de Chimbo. El sueño es tener lo necesario para vivir comodamente. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar con los hijos.
texts.en:
Jose Olmedo is 37 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and has two daughters. He lives with his partner and children in Chimbo, province of Bolivar.

Jose Olmedo is the owner of a telephone booths business. He is requesting a loan in order to buy a refrigerator. With the help of this loan he will be able to buy what he needs for the bar. He will make his purchases in the city of Chimbo. 

His dream is to have sufficient to be able to live comfortably. The biggest challenge he faces is competition. In his free time he likes to play with his children.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Petre

texts.en:
Petre is 44 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, Petre has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, slippers, cups, plates and saucepans. 

To help expand his business, Petre has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap to resell, helping Petre to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. Petre hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business into a wholesale shop. 

Petre is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). This program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Petre who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap to resell.

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en:
Jhona is a 22-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for more than four years now. This is the source of their income.

Jhona is asking for a loan to buy a new boat engine. With this, her husband will be able to go back to fishing and catch more fish to sell in the market. Jhona has hopes of making her business a success and saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine

loans.name: Takeu

texts.en:
Takeu is now 30 years old and a father of three. He got a good harvest during the last season and this has enabled him to cultivate a larger portion of his land.

He has acquired a loan of 40,000 from KADET LTD with which he intends to also start livestock trading as another business besides the growing of wheat. So he will use the loan to buy cows and goats for resale, as a part of business diversification. 

He hopes to improve the family's living standard and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy cows and goats for resale.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is a 43-year-old married woman from San Miguel, Bohol and mother of a 12-year-old daughter. She is a farmer and has been growing rice for 15 years. Her husband is also a farmer. She earns 5,000 pesos a month by doing this farming. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and rice seedlings. In the future, Anita would like to invest in other businesses to augment her income and at the same time to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seedlings

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua  sells secondhand ladies' and children's dresses, and she has been selling secondhand dresses for five  years now.   Ekua is married; her husband is an auto electrician.   She uses her income to assist her husband to  pay their utility and accommodation bills. Ekua needs this loan to purchase more secondhand ladies' and children's dresses to sell. With the new profit Ekua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand ladies' and children's dresses to sell.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en: Adwowa   produces charcoal  for sale at  Abura  near  Cape Coast, which she has done for two years now. Adwowa  is married  and has seven dependents  She uses her income  to assist her husband to  feed the family and pay their children’s school fees.  Adwowa  will use her loan to purchase firewood  to  produce charcoal  to  sell.  With the new profit from her expanded business  Adwowa will produce charcoal in large quantity.

loans.use: purchase firewood  to  produce charcoal  to  sell

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is 51 years old and is from Gaza. He is married. He has owned a small grocery store since 2009.

He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a refrigerator and goods for the store. He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and goods for the store

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick  is a married man. He describes himself to be a self-driven man and focused. He operates a carpentry workshop  where he sells furniture. He has been involved in this business for 12 years. His business is located at a residential area and his primary customers are local residents . He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds for business expansion. 

Patrick will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy equipment and tools for carpentry. His business goal is to run multiple carpentry workshops within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He previously managed to repay a loan of Kes 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy carpentry equipment and tools

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena   is the lady with  roasted fish.  Abena   operates  a chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold). She has done this for five years.   The dishes   she  serves  are 'fufu', 'banku' and rice balls. She lives together with her husband and  three  dependents.   Abena  uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s   school fees. She will use her loan to purchase fish, meat, foodstuffs and other ingredients to prepare her  food for sale. With the new profit,  Abena  plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: purchase fish, meat, foodstuffs and other ingredient to prepare her  food for sale.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is 28 years old. She has owned a beauty salon since 2009.

She asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy make-up, cosmetics, and furniture for the salon. She hopes that this loan will help her improve her income so she can enlarge her work space.

loans.use: to buy make-up, cosmetics, and furniture for the salon

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en:
Agartha is a food vender. She cooks banku (a local dish made from corn dough and served with soup or stew) for sale. She serves it with okra and fish stew. This she has done for five years. She lives together with her husband in Edukrom near Cape Coast. She is married  and has five children. Her husband  is a trader. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  

Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize to prepare her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to create a place for her customers to eat.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to prepare her banku (a local dish made from corn dough and served with soup or stew) for sale.

loans.name: Zamu

texts.en:
Zamu is 30 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Zamu has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which sells eggs and chickens. 

To help expand her business, Zamu has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicken feeds and chicks for her farm, and will help Zamu to generate greater profits and enable her to pay her children's school fees. Zamu hopes that in the future, she will be able to open up a drug shop in her village. 

Zamu is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Zamu who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to be able to buy more chicken feeds and chicks for her farm.

loans.name: Tawfiq

texts.en:
Tawfiq is 40 years old and from Gaza. He is married. He owns a food cart for selling bread.

He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a small automobile. Tawfiq hopes that this loan will help him move easier and improve his income though increasing sales.

loans.use: to buy a small automobile.

loans.name: Rayangnewende Donald Auguste

texts.fr:
Mr RAYANGNEWENDE DONALD AUGUSTE est étudiant en 03ème année  spécialisation médecine  en Endocrinologie à l’Université de Bamako au Mali. Marié, il est père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 02ans et le moins âgé a 01an. Ils ne vont pas à l’école et Mr a 03personnes à sa charge.
Mr est médecin depuis 04ans.
Il veut financer sa spécialisation médicale en Endocrinologie(formation académique).
Mr ambitionne pouvoir compléter le programme de formation spécialisée en Endocrinologie et ensuite s’installer à son compte comme spécialiste dans ce domaine.
texts.en:
RAYANGNEWENDE DONALD AUGUSTE is a student in his third year of medical studies in endocrinology at the University of Bamako in Mali. He is married and has two children. His eldest child is two years old, and his youngest child is one year old. Neither of his children go to school. He has three people living in his care.

He has been a doctor for four years now.

He wants to finance his medical specialization in endocrinology (academic training).

His goal is to complete the specialized training program in endocrinology, then start working for himself in the field of endocrinology.

loans.use: to finance his medical specialization (academic training)

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes de 49 años vive con su cónyuge y tienen 4 hijos en las edades de 16 a 30 años. Ella inició su negocio cuando procedente de Buenaventura, el Puerto marítimo más importante en la región del Pacífico Colombiano, llegó a la ciudad para buscar mejores alternativas de vida pacifica y productiva para su familia. Mercedes había adquirido su experiencia de tienda en su tierra natal y una vez se trasladó a la ciudad de Barranquilla, la re- tomó y la convirtió en su forma de generar ingresos, apoyadas por su familia que la recibió con una gran acogida. Su meta es lograr la plena sostenibilidad de su negocio y por eso debe crecer, en la misma proporción que lo hace su clientela, pero sus inventarios no son suficientes para responder a ellos con las mercancías que mas rotan. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los anteriores compró víveres, ranchos y verduras, en mayor volumen con lo cual logró mejores descuentos que capitalizaon un poco mas su negocio y hoy buscará hacerlo mas rentable, porque agregó planes de celulares y recargas que le significan un nuevo ingreso.   Con su credikiva con una parte de él intenta fortalecer su negocio de comunicaciones, agregando nuevos planes y recargas a celulares y es que esto es justamente lo que hará que su credikiva sea potencialmente exitoso, porque gradualmente impactará el crecimiento de su tienda con un nuevo servicio y por otra parte tambien servirá su ccrédito para pagar el semestre universitario de su hija, por eso Mercedes dice a sus financiaores ;" muchas gracias por el apoyo pues en su condicion de desplazada está logrando con su familia salir adelante y esto es gracias a Kiva.
texts.en:
Mercedes, age 49, lives with her husband.  They have four children between the ages of 16 and 30.  She started her business when she left Buenaventura, the most important seaport in the Pacífico Colombiano region.  She arrived in the city to look for better ways of living peacefully and productively for her family.

Mercedes had acquired store experience in her native land.  Once she moved to Barranquilla, she took it up again.  She turned it into her way of generating income.  She was supported by her family, and she was very well-received. 

Her goal is to manage complete sustainability in her business.  To do so, she needs to grow at the same rate as her clientele.  However, she does not have enough inventory to respond to her customers with the merchandise that turns over the most.  

This is exactly the reason she turns to a Kiva loan.  This is her second loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the previous one she bought groceries, snacks, and vegetables in greater volume in order to get discounts.  This capitalized her business a little more.  Now she will look to make it more profitable because she has added cell phone plans and recharges, which means a new income for her. 

She intends to use part of her Kiva loan to strengthen her communications business by adding new cell plans and recharges.  This is exactly what she will do so that her Kiva loan will be potentially successful.  This is because it will gradually impact the growth of her store with a new service.  She will use the other part of her loan to pay for her daughter’s semester at the university.

This is why Mercedas says to her lenders, “Thank you for the support.  In my situation of not being from this place, I am managing to get ahead with my family, and this is thanks to Kiva.”

loans.use: to buy new cell plans and recharges and to pay  for her daughter's semester at the university.

loans.name: Shakuul

texts.en:
Shakuul lives together with her husband and four children in Edudrom near Cape Coast. Her husband is a laborer at the University of Cape Coast.

Shakuul operates a grocery shop, which she has done for eight years. The items in her grocery shop are rice, cooking oil, tinned fish, tinned tomatoes, Milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, milk, soap, etc.   

Shakuul uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s  school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Shakuul plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is a 35-year-old married man and the father of one child. He has been manufacturing furniture since 1992. Samir was only 15 years old when he started working to help his parents in making their living and covering his expenses.

His work is going on just fine, but he always needs an external push to be able to fulfill unexpected additional requests. His special wide experience and good reputation pushes him to work harder to expand and improve his business. Samir is applying for a loan from Kiva parnter Al Majmoua in order to buy extra wood necessary for a new project he is working on. 

This is Samir's sixth loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. He is in good standing and has a good history of paying loans back. With his previous loans, he was capable of renewing some of his tools and improving his living. He hopes that one day, he will open his own special showroom to attract new customers.

loans.use: To buy extra wood necessary for a new project he is working on.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells cosmetics in Edukrom near Cape Coast. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a electrician. She uses her income to assist her husband with paying their utility bills. 

Mary will use her loan to purchase a variety of cosmetics to sell. With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Yowasi

texts.en:
Yowasi is a resident of Rwampara, a village in Mbarara district. He is a 48-year-old man, married, with seven children who are all in school. He has been in the business of farming with various agricultural income-generating projects, like cattle rearing and banana farming. This business has helped him to look after his family and also pay school fees of his children. 

Yowasi is requesting for a loan of UGX 1,300,000/= to pay school fees for his children since the long holiday is almost over. He has a challenge, trying to raise school fees for his children since schools usually begin at the same time. He, therefore, has to have a lot of money at that time.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 50 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is widowed with four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past year, Irene has been working hard to manage her Agro shop where she sells poultry feed and fertilizers. 

Irene is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more agro-chemicals and poultry feed to expand her business. Her loan will help her generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to able to support her family. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Irene who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more agro-chemicals and poultry feed

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is married with dependents. For the past 10 years, she has been selling smoked fish. Leila uses her income to support her husband and feed and clothe their children.

Leila is requesting a loan to purchase fresh fish in large quantity to smoke and sell. She will use the profit from her loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is married with four dependents. For the past 30 years, she has been a fish monger, buying fresh fish from the market and smoking it to sell. Esi uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children.  

Esi is requesting a loan to purchase fresh fish in large quantity to smoke for sale. She will use the profit from her loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is a married man. He describes himself to be a hard-working man. He operates a hardware retail store where he sells items such as cement, paints, and pipes. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances to expand his business. 

Sammy will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy paints, cement, pipes, etc. to sell. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy paints, cement, pipes, etc. for his hardware store.

loans.name: Naponu

texts.en:
Naponu is 29 years old and blessed with six children. She is a livestock trader in Narok and has been running the business for the past three years, making a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She has borrowed a second loan of KES 40,000 from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), which she intends to use to purchase more goats and sheep, to fatten and sell later. 

The anticipated profit will be reinvested, to boost business. Naponu's future dream is to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more goats and sheep for sale.

loans.name: Segundo Victor

texts.es:
SEGUNDO VICTOR tiene 50 años de edad es soltero tiene 3 hijos, vive con los hijos en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

SEGUNDO VICTOR se dedica a la agricultura a la siembras de maíz, cebada. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, líquido para la maleza, urea, ranger. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es luchar  si se presenta cualquier plaga con la agricultura. En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirce con la familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Victor is 50 years old.  He’s single and has three children whom he lives with in Chimbo, within the Bolívar province.

Segundo Victor is a farmer and raises corn and barley.  He is asking for this loan to buy insecticides, weed killer, urea, and other supplies.

This loan will help him to buy what he needs for arming.  His challenges are fighting the blights.  He likes to get together with his family in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 48-year-old widowed woman. She has ten children. She describes herself to be an honest woman. She operates a rental-house business where she provides accommodation. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 15,600 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy a water tank, which will be used by her six family members. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat to sell

loans.name: Doras

texts.en:
Doras is married and has five children. For the past eight years, she has sold charcoal at  Abura, near Cape Coast. Doras uses her income to support her husband to feed and pay their children’s school fees.  

Doras is requesting a loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell. She hopes to use the profit from her expanded business to produce her own charcoal.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua lives with her husband and two children in Edukrom, near Cape Coast. Her husband works with a communication company. For the past three years, Efua has operated  a  general store where she sells rice, cooking oil, tinned fish, tinned tomatoes, Milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, milk, and soap. She uses her income to support her husband to pay for their children's school fees.    

Efua is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of provisions to sell. She plans to use the profit from her loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase variety of provisions to sell

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines. He is a married man. Henry has been in the rice-farming business for more than two years now. This is the source of his income.

Henry wants to improve his farming business, but lacks the financial resources to do so. Because of this, he is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this loan, he will be able to improve his farm, thus increasing his yield and profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells charcoal at Edukrom, near Cape Coast, which she has done for 13 years. Mary is married and has six children. She uses her income to support her husband, to feed and pay their children’s school fees. 

Mary will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Mary will produce the charcoal she sells, herself.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Maryline

texts.en: Maryline is a 32-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be ambitious and industrious. She operates a beauty salon  where she provides hair services. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located within a busy and populated residential area where she does her hair services and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the shortage of beauty hair salon equipment. She will use the KES 15000 loan to buy beauty salon equipment. Her business goal is to run a well-established beauty salon within 5 years.

loans.use: buy beauty salon equipment

loans.name: Sirojiddin

texts.ru:
Сирожиддин мужчина в возрасте 34 лет, живет в сельской местности Дж. Расуловского района. Он женат имеет двоих детей, сына и дочь.    Он занимается  откармливанием крупно рогатого скота у себя дома. Жена домохозяйка она воспитывает своих детей, но в свободное время помогает мужу.  Откармливание КРС это их семейный традиционный бизнес.   Сирожиддин  покупает теленка  и  в течение года откармливает его и продает мясникам которые торгуют на  рынке по дороже.  На данный момент его поголовье скота уменьшилось  так как две его коровы заболели и ему пришлось срочно продать месячникам. Теперь он хочет увеличить скот и до весны откормив продать за хорошую прибыль. 
  На полученный кредит Сирожиддин  планирует  купить крупно рогатый скот и расширить свой бизнес. Он заранее благодарит организацию Кива за финансовую поддержку и помощь.
texts.en:
Sirojiddin is a 34 year old man, he lives in the village of J. Rasulov region. He is married and has two children, a son and a daughter. He feeds large horned cattle at home. His wife is a homemaker and is raising their children, but during the free time helps her husband.

Feeding large horned cattle is their traditional family business. Sirojiddin buys a calf and feeds it during the year and then sells to the butchers who sell it a higher price on the market. At this time the headcount of cattle has decreased because two cows got sick and he had to sell them quickly to the butchers. Now he wants to increase the cattle headcount, feed it and then sells it at spring time for a good profit.

Sirojiddin plans to use the loan to buy large horned cattle and expand his business. He is thanking Kiva for the financial support and help in advance.

loans.use: to buy a cattle.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en: Apolonia is a 58-year-old, married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She has two grown children. She is engaged in selling meat and chicken barbeque to customers in her community. In addition to barbeque vending, she operates a multicab ( a vehicle used to transport passengers). She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase spare parts, tires and gasoline for her multicab operation. In the future, Apolonia would like to expand her business, for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, tires and gasoline for her passenger transport business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 28-year-old, married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from two years to 11 years. She describes herself as being a diligent and courteous woman. 

She operates a green-grocery stall where she sells vegetables and fruits, such as mangoes, kale, and potatoes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power, sometimes, from the residents. 

Mercy will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits to sell. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for her green-grocery stall.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 53-year-old married woman who has been working in selling home products since seven years ago. Fatima started her business to help her husband in making their living and to fill her free time with something productive and useful, as she says.

Fatima is applying for her first cycle loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy a van necessary for distributing her products because she is intending to start a wholesale trade.

She is a hardworking woman, with a special trading talent and a remarkable reputation.

Fatima is working on expanding her shop through opening her two business’ shops onto each other and improving the decoration. Her other business is the initial one; she deals in flowers and special occasions decorations.

loans.use: to buy a van necessary for distributing her products.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 48-year-old, married man who has been working in the agriculture business for 20 years. He is specialized in taking care of, planting, and decorating gardens. 

Mouhamad is applying for his fifth cycle loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, in order to make necessary maintenance on his house, to keep it a healthy living place, especially in the winter season.

Mouhamad's good reputation is remarkable, his customers recommend him to many others. He hopes to keep on expanding his working zone and improving his necessary tools and machines.

loans.use: To make necessary maintenance on his house.

loans.name: Rida

texts.en:
Rida is a 50-year-old, married man, father of three children. He has been working in the mechanic business, manufacturing special metal parts for 30 years. Rida is very talented in his business and well known in his community. 

Rida is applying for his first cycle loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, in order to change his car's engine,  which is very important for his business transportation and customer service.

In the beginning, Rida was a worker in his shop and he developed himself to be a partner. In the future, he hopes to keep on expanding his work through opening another branch.

loans.use: to change his car's engine for his business transportation and customer service.

loans.name: Lercy

texts.es: Lercy en su taller de costuras invirtió su anterior credikiva, ella compró telas, hilos y algunas herramientas con las cuales trabaja aun mejor. Cuando accedió a su credikiva le fue muy bien porque tenia mas dinero en sus manos para hacer compras en mayor cantidad y respondió con ella a su clientela real y potencial, dar cumplimiento a un contrato con una importante clínica de la ciudad, por eso comprará telas e insumos.Su mensaje a sus finaciadores "Gracias a la gente de Kiva por el apoyo que me brindan a mi y a mi familia. "
texts.en:
Lercy invested her previous Kiva loan in her seamstress shop.  She bought fabric, thread, and some tools with which she works even better.  When she got her Kiva loan it was very good for her because she had more money in hand to make purchases in greater quantity.

She used it to respond to her current and potential customers and to complete a contract with an important clinic in the city.  Therefore, she will buy fabric and supplies.  Her message to her lenders is, “Thank you to the Kiva lenders for the support you give to me and my family.”

loans.use: to buy fabric and supplies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks wholesale

loans.name: Auma Vini

texts.en:
Auma is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Nimule. She is married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 11 years. All of them go to school.

Auma runs a fruit and vegetable selling business, and she has been in business for seven years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 1600 SSP to purchase greens, lemons, and many other fruits and vegetables. She has no other source of income, besides this business.

Within five years, Auma would like to have expanded her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Auma says she is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan, with the help of kiva.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables, like greens, e.g. dodo, and lemons.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas lives in Jacob Town. She is 49 years old and married, with four children between 15 to 28 years old. Only one is in school and lives at home.

For the past six years, Dorcas has been selling slippers and children's clothes in her community. She started this business from her savings, and she enjoys the independence. She says that sometimes buying goes slow.

Dorcas is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers and children's clothes for her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and children's clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie, 40 years old, lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She has 5 children between the ages of 5 and 15 years old. For the past three years, she has been running a shop in the local market where she sells lappa (fabric). She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes daily to provide money for her expenses makes her proud of her business. A problem she faces is that prices are too high since she has to buy in USD and sell in LRD. She is requesting a loan to purchase more lappa for her business. Her dream is to become a big businesswoman and to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa (fabric) for her business,

loans.name: Cathrine

texts.en: Cathrine lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known market areas in Montserrado County.  She is 37 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 4 and 14 that live at home and go to school.  For the past five years she has been selling used clothes in the local market.  Not enough income is the problem she faces now.  She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profits she generates every day.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business.  In the near future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known market areas in Montserrado county. She is 48 years old and single with four children between the ages of 15 and 28. Only one of them is in school and they all live at home. For 8 years she has been selling door locks, door catches, nails and other items in her community. Too little income is the problem she faces now. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she gets every day. Theresa is requesting a loan to purchase door locks, door catches, nails and other items for her business. Her dream is to have a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase door locks, door catches, nails and other items for her business.

loans.name: Al Sadaka Group

texts.en:
Samira is a 38-year-old, married woman, and the mother of three children. She is a hard-working woman. In 2009, she started selling Brazilian gold and beauty cosmetics. Samira works from her house, to manage both her business and family issues. Her husband supported her a lot at the beginning, and now she is capable enough to manage her business.

Samira applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to pay for her children's school fees. She hopes to expand her business more and more in the future, and stay capable of supporting her family as much as she can.

Fawziya is a 62-year-old, divorced woman with no children. She is the one on the right. She worked hard to start her own business, so that she wouldn't need anyone's help. Fifteen years ago, Fawziya started selling clothes with the help of her sister's children, who gave her the capital requested to start a business of her own. It was a hard step to take, but she had to make her own career. With the requested loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, Fawziya will increase her beauty creams and cosmetics capital, buying inventory to reply better to her customers' requests.

Safiya is a 61-year-old, married woman and the mother of one child. Safiya is in the middle. In 1997, she started her own business selling gifts and antiques. Safiya is a courageous woman who works hard to reach her goals. She is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to increase her merchandise with specially released products. She hopes to open a wider gifts and antiques shop, to better display her products. Fatima hopes to succeed more and more in her business in the future.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 35-year-old, married man. He has three children. He describes himself as an innovative and humble man. He operates a restaurant, where he sells meals, snacks, tea, etc. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an area conducive to business, and his primary customers are local residents. He says his biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy food ingredients for preparing meals, tea, and snacks to sell. His business goal is to improve the business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meals, tea and snacks, to sell in his restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cloth and materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables for her husband's vegetable-selling business.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en: Felicisima is a 47-year-old farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She has two children ages 17 and 15. Felicisima has been helping her husband for more than 25 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Felicisima is optimistic and she believes that this loan could help them in improving their farm. In the future, Felicisima hopes of making their business a success. Moreover, she wants to continue supporting the schooling of her children and hopes to see them as successful professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Mujeres De Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres de Fortaleza está conformado, por 8 integrantes, madres solteras, con 15 hijos menores bajo sus responsabilidad. Son originarias del  Malpaisillo, lugar que se caracteriza por sus trabajos artesanales, y la producción de leche, cuajada, queso.
Lamentablemente desde muy joven ha tenido que trabajar, para darles el sustento a sus hijos y brindarle mayores posibilidades. Petrona es la coordinadora del banco comunal, que gracias a su espíritu y ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica la venta de cuajada en su casa y de forma ambulante. La rutina diaria de Petrona es trabajar unas 8 horas ofreciendo sus cuajadas a los pobladores de la comunidad. Con una pana en su cabeza de unos 20 kg, actividad que la realiza con mucho gusto ya que ha sido el medio de vida y la de sus hijos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de cuajada para que en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Mujeres de Fortaleza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Mujeres de Fortaleza” (Women of Strength) is made up of 8 members, all single mothers with 15 minor children under their responsibility.  They come from Malpaisillo, a place that is characterized by its handicrafts and the production of milk, curds and cheese. 

Unfortunately, since they were very young they have had to work in order to support their children and provide them better possibilities.  Petrona is the coordinator of the communal bank, thanks to her spirit and desire to get ahead.  As her economic activity, she sells curds in her house and as a street vendor.  Petrona’s daily routine is to work some 8 hours offering her curds to the inhabitants of her community with a basket on her head of some 20 kg, an activity that she carries out with pleasure since it has been the way of life for her and her children.  

The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business in the buying and selling of curds in order to obtain a better income in the not too distant future.

The communal bank “Mujeres de Fortaleza” is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to people of limited resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so that they have a way to work with dignity.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock her business in the buying and selling of curds to offer to the inhabitants of her community.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba produces charcoal for sale, at Edukrom, near Cape Coast. She has done this for 30 years. Aba is a widow and has three children. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children, and to pay their school fees.

Aba will use her loan to purchase firewood, for making charcoal to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Aba will produce charcoal in larger quantity.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, for use in producing charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of flour, 1 sack of sugar, butter, and oil.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 31-year-old married woman who has two young children. The older child is 5 and the younger is 4. 

Gina has been engaged in a rice farming business together with her husband for more than eight years now. She is asking for a loan to buy to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve their farm, especially their harvest.

Gina dreams of expanding their farming business and saves money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Oyuntuya

texts.en:
Oyuntuya is 42 years old lives with her husband and son in a small house in the Orhon province of Mongolia. Her husband, Ganbayar, is 34 and works as a salesperson at a local butcher shop. Oyuntuya's son, Bayasgalantogoldor, is six years old and goes to a local primary school. Since 2004, Oyuntuya has been running an organic dairy products business in the local market. She has gained a lot of experience and a number of regular customers over the years. 

Oyuntuya is requesting a 1,050,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products to sell at her counter in the local market. She is a hardworking, enthusiastic, and caring woman.

loans.use: to purchase organic dairy products to sell at her counter in the local market

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 48-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, ages ranging from 21 to 24 years. Lucy describes herself to be an innovative woman. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located within a potential business area and her primary customers are local residents. Lucy describes her biggest business challenge to be frequently changing fashion styles. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to pay for her children's school fees. Her business goal is to move her business to a more viable business environment  within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en:
Mirna is a 29-year-old married woman, mother of three children, who has been working as a tutor for five years. Mirna is a hard worker who is putting so much effort to help her husband in covering their children needs.

Mirna is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to open a tutoring center, to attract more students and increase her income to develop their living. This is her third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower with a good standing pay back history. Her previous loans helped her buy extra laptops and special tutoring needs to help her teach her students better at her house. She hopes that one day she might turn her tutoring center into an important school.

loans.use: To open a tutoring center

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia sells clothing in Elmina. Felicia has received schooling through senior high school.  She is single and has 1 child. Felicia has been selling clothing for some time now. She is responsible for paying her and her child’s expenses.  Her loan will be used to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothing to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to increase her capital base and grow her clothes selling trade.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice  is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be a business-minded woman and a serious businesswoman. 

She operates a grocery store  where she sells fruits and vegetables. Her business is located within a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high transportation cost of vegetables and fruits. 

Eunice will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. Her business goal is to expand her grocery store to a wholesale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM) after successfully paying a loan of KES 20,000.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for her grocery store.

loans.name: Porfirio  Omar

texts.es:
Omar es un hombre de 31 años, trabajó desde que era un niño ayudando a sus padres, pero sin descuidar sus estudios, los cuales, logró terminar hasta la secundaria. Omar ha tenido que educar solo a sus dos hijos Charly y Ximena de 11 y 7 años respectivamente, ellos son la razón por la cual cada día este hombre, sin duda esforzado, se levanta para trabajar duro y así llevar el sustento a su hogar. Por varias circunstancias adversas, vive solo con sus hijos en Los Bancos un cantón de la Provincia de Pichincha, una de las provincias  más grandes en la República del Ecuador. Este cantón se encuentra a pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Quito, y tiene diversidad de bosques, además sus barrios están poblados con gente amable y costumbres propias de esta ciudad en donde también se encuentran establecidas varias microempresas administradas por los emprendedores que luchan por hacer realidad sus sueños cada día. Otras de las actividades sobresalientes son la agricultura y la ganadería, produciendo abundantes cultivos que luego son comercializados para distribuirse hacia muchas provincias. También posee varios atractivos turísticos como cascadas, ríos, senderos, balnearios en donde el turista es atraído por los deportes de aventura que se venden allí con seguridad garantizada. 
Omar se dedica a la comercialización de madera, actividad que aprendió con sus padres desde muy chico y luego se convirtió en su sustento. En el inicio fue difícil incursionar en el mercado, pues los permisos para llevar a cabo esta actividad tienen un nivel considerable de dificultad, pero Omar no se dio por vencido y avanzó hasta tener su negocio en regla. Ahora ya lleva 15 años con su emprendimiento al cual le dedica al menos 10 horas cada día en la carga, ubicación, limpieza y pulida de madera. Las herramientas que utiliza están desgatadas y ahora necesita comprar nuevas, para lo cual Omar requiere un préstamo y ha solicitado ayuda en Fundación Alternativa quien a través de Kiva y gracias a todos ustedes, lograrán que este padre de familia pueda ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes y de esta forma incrementar sus clientes y por ende sus ingresos con lo cual podrá brindar a sus hijos una educación de calidad basada en valores y excelencia para que un día puedan aportar al crecimiento económico y social del Ecuador.
texts.en:
Omar is 31 years old and has been working since he was a child, helping his parents.  However, he never neglected his studies and succeeded in completing secondary school.  Omar has had to bring up his two children alone.  Named Charly (11 years old) and Ximena (seven years), his children are the reason that this strong man gets up to work hard and support the household.  As a result of various bad circumstances, Omar lives alone with his children in the Los Bancos canton, in one of Ecuador's biggest provinces, Pichincha.  Only a few kilometres from the city of Quito, Los Bancos has a variety of forests and its neighbourhoods are filled with friendly people and local traditions.  Many microbusinesses are to be found here, all run by entrepreneurs that fight every day to make their dreams a reality.  Other important industries in the area are agriculture and cattle raising.  This produces an abundance of crops which are later sold and distributed to many different provinces.  The canton also has various tourist attractions such as waterfalls, rivers, paths and seaside resorts where tourists come for adventure sports that can practiced safely here.

Omar sells wood.  He learned this trade with his parents from a young age and it later became his living.  At the beginning it was difficult to enter the market as obtaining the necessary permits is quite difficult.  However, Omar did not give up and kept going until his business was set up.  Now he has been doing this work for 15 years, working at least ten hours a day locating, carrying, cleaning and polishing wood.  The tools he uses are worn out and he now needs to buy new ones.  For this Omar needs a loan, so he has asked for help from Fundación Alternativa who, thanks to Kiva and to all of you, will be able to help this father offer a better product to his customers.  As a result, he will increase his customer base and, consequently, his income.  This will allow him to provide his children with an upbringing based on values and excellence so that one day they can contribute to the social and economic growth of Ecuador.

loans.use: to buy tools for treating and polishing wood.

loans.name: Falastine

texts.en:
Falastine is 23 years old and lives in Gaza. She has owned a dry cleaning shop since 2010.

She asked Ryada for this Youth Loan, in order to buy a steam iron and enlarge the space in which she conducts business. She hopes that this loan will help her improve her income .

loans.use: to buy a steam iron, and enlarge the space in which she conducts her dry cleaning business.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as an ambitious man. He operates a motorcycle, with which he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an area conducive to business, and his primary customers are local residents. He says his biggest business challenge is the poor road network, especially during rainy seasons.

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase another motorcycle, which will increase his ability to provide transportation. His business goal is to run a retail shop within 5 years. This is his fifth loan with SMEP DTM, after taking a previous loan of KES 30,000, which he managed to repay successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle, which will increase his capacity to provide transportation services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of maize flour, packets of sweets, crates of milk, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment and tools

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is married with three children. Her husband is a farmer. Monica has been selling clothing at the Elmina market in Elmina for some time now. She received schooling through junior high school. Monica is responsible for helping to support her husband and taking care of her children's expenses. 

Monica is requesting a loan to buy more clothing to sell. She hopes to use the profit from her loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 29 years old and lives in the town of Mubende, in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past four years, Rose has been working hard to manage her clothing store, where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more trousers, shirts and skirts for sale. This will help Rose to generate greater profits and finish her rental houses. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into a wholesale shop. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more trousers, shirts and skirts to sell in her store

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is a 59-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband is a farmer. She engages in a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells soft drinks, noodles, seasonings and biscuits. She has been in the sari-sari store business for five years.

Aurea requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy more commodities to sell like sugar, coffee, canned goods and soft drinks. 

In the future, Aurea would like to expand her business to augment for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more commodities to sell like sugar, coffee, canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a Lebanese married man. He’s 51 years old and has two working children. They are really attached and do not hesitate to cooperate together for a better and respectable way of living. 

Khalil started his business in 2004. He had to work really hard to prove that he’s a necessary support for his family. He sells car spare parts and has gained a fair number of customers asking for his services. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy added spare parts in order to respond rapidly to his clients’ problems. He believes that acting properly is really essential to attracting more and new customers. He seeks to develop his work in the near future and better support his family.

loans.use: to buy added spare parts in order to respond rapidly to his clients’ problems

loans.name: Enkaiser

texts.en:
Enkaiser has completed repaying her previous loan, after a good wheat harvest. She has acquired another loan of KES 60,000, which will facilitate her purchase of livestock, for fattening and resale at a profit, in the quest of diversifying her business.

She hopes to grow into a large-scale farmer and to provide a high level of education for her children.

loans.use: to buy wheat seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 24-year-old single man. He is living with his parents and three siblings, two of whom are working. His father is the main income provider for the family and works very hard to be able to handle the heavy life expenses. 

Kassem has been involved in the construction field since 2007. He is well-known in his town and has gained a fair number of clients so far, despite his younger age. And today, he is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed construction tools for his business. 

This will definitely allow Kassem to achieve his work competently and be able to present good-quality services to the clients. He works on a freelance basis, and hopes to take bigger projects and increase his earnings in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase needed construction tools for his business.

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader is a 24-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and three siblings. Two of them are working. In 2010, in order to supplement the family’s income, he decided to start his own work. He opened his own vegetable shop. He knows very well how to select his produce and satisfy his clients the best he can. 

Today, he is asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to enlarge his business and purchase the needed quantity of vegetables to sell. He states that the loan will certainly help him increase his business productivity by a fair percentage which will bring him higher profits. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and purchase land where he can cultivate a wider variety of vegetables.

loans.use: to enlarge his business and purchase the needed quantity of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 36-year-old married man. He’s married to Faten, a beautiful young woman and the mother of his only child. 

Walid has been working as a taxi driver since 2010. His main route is between his town and the surrounding villages; and he also does private transportation upon client’s requests. His business income is very important as he represents the only income source for the family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform needed maintenance on his car such as changing the tires, repairing the engine and painting the body, etc. He states that these repairs will make his transportation safer and will help him attract more customers. This is his first Kiva loan and he hopes to be able to improve his business as well as the family’s financial situation.

loans.use: to perform needed maintenance on his car such as changing the tires, repairing the engine and painting the body, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is single and the mother of one child. She has received schooling through junior high and now earns a living by selling beverages and food, including rice, sugar, and water in the town of Elmina. She has been in this line of work for some time now and is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. With the new profit she expects to earn, Grace plans to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Evergista

texts.en: Evergista is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines. Evergista is a farmer and has been in the farming business with her husband for more than two years now. This is their main source of income. Evergista is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With a loan, Evergista will be able to improve their farm and their harvest, thus augmenting their yield and income. Evergista hopes to make her business a success so that it will continue to generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing breakfasts and also to buy merchandise such as footwear, clothes and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Assurance De Phaeton Group

texts.fr:
Jaccint est le coordinateur de son groupe Assurance de Phaeton. Il habite dans la région de Assurance où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Jaccint a dirigé son commerce de poisson pendant les 9 et demi dernières années. Il est marie il a 4 enfants.

Jaccint voudrait utiliser cet emprunt d'investir dans l'achat de poisson. Jaccint espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son entreprise Des autres membres Assurance ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon, vetements usees et produits alimentaires.
texts.en:
Jaccint is the coordinator of his group Assurance de Phaeton. He lives in the region of Assurance where electricity is rare and water is very scarce. Jaccint managed his fish-selling business during the 9 and a half past years. He is married and has 4 children.

Jaccint would like to use this loan to invest in the purchase of fish. Jaccint hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business. Other members of Assurance need a loan for businesses such as charcoal, used clothing and food stuffs.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 28-year-old, single lady, and the mother of a son, aged 4 years. She operates a greengrocery in Narok county. She has been in the business for the past three years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. She has recently opened a small food cafe, which has boosted her income.

She has applied for a business loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD. She will use the loan funds to expand her now-very-busy greengrocery, by buying more stock of fruits and vegetables.

She hopes to use the profit to enlarge her new food cafe.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man, and he has four children. He describes himself as an ambitious man. He operates a poultry business, where he sells chickens. He has been involved in this business for 25 years. His primary customers are hotels and local residents. He says his biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business.

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy chicks and their food. His business goal is to buy more chicks for business expansion, within five years. In addition to the poultry business, Stephen runs a dairy farm, which adds to the business income he earns. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and their food

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with six children and none of her children is in school. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She takes care of one additional family member (her grandchild). She has been in this business for the last eight years. She works seven days a week, and she gets additional income from hiring out her motorcycle. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

Florence has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 1,300,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more  bags of charcoal.   Her aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but has no access to piped water. Her major expenses monthly include school fees for the grandchild and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 23-year-old man. He’s married and lives in Lebanon with his wife. He is considered the main income provider for the family. Despite his young age, Hasan is obliged to work continually as he plans to have his own family and children. 

Hasan has been working in the construction field since 2008. He’s specialized in floor covering and has gained a fair number of clients asking for his services. Despite being satisfied with what he has attained so far, he suffers from a bad financial situation; and that’s the reason why he’s asking today for a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to improve his business by purchasing new construction tools as he plans to keep on offering the best quality of work ever.

 In the near future, Hasan plans to take added loans to open his own paving shop. This is why he works really hard to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to improve his business by purchasing new construction tools

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 37-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and five children. One is working and the others are still attending school. 

Youssef works in his town and has his own vegetables shop. He makes good income from his product sales, but he suffers financially, especially during disturbing weather, since the selling rate is very low at this period. This was the motive for him to request a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. Youssef plans to purchase a fair quantity of vegetables for his business so as to increase his sales, and thus his income. 

This will be Youssef’s first Kiva loan. He is sure that it will help him achieve remarkable growth in a short term.
