loans.use: to purchase a fair quantity of vegetables for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fresh onions for resale

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en: Jenefer lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last seven years. She works six days a week. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas.   Her aspirations are to own a delivery van to help with transportation and to build her own house. She lives in a rented house. The family has access to electricity, but has no access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 43-year-old married woman and mother of five children.  She puts alot of effort into helping her husband in covering their needs and replying to their requests. Amina is a hard working woman.  She has been selling cosmetics and perfumes for seven years. 
Amina is requesting her third cycle loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to pay for a medical surgery she has to undergo.
She hopes that she can improve her business more and more to keep her family members satisfied.

loans.use: to pay for a surgery she has to do

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a farmer from Bien Unido, Bohol, Philippines. She is 62 years old and has been in the farming business together with her husband for more than 40 years now. Erlinda needs a loan to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for their rice field. Erlinda hopes to make her business a success.  She saves money for the reinvestment into the business so that it will generate more revenue and she can repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for their rice field

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is a 20-year-old married woman form Lebanon. She lives with her husband who serves in the Lebanese army and is working really hard as he is the one responsible for covering the family expenses. 

Malak has owned a beauty salon since 2009 and she welcomes customers to provide them with beauty services such as hairdressing, make-up, etc. Today, she is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase her inventory of new beauty products and supplies. She intends to enhance her work operations by offering her clients high-quality services in order to satisfy their demand and keep them loyal to her shop. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business into other areas.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of new beauty products and supplies

loans.name: Beqir

texts.en:
Beqir, 63 years old, is a married father of two children. For a long time, he worked for a company as a seller of different items. Now, he is planning to change his garage into a small food shop (as shown in the picture).  He believes that the opening of the food shop in his area will be profitable for him because there are many demands in his area. He is a very hardworking and ambitious man.

Beqir is requesting a loan in order to start his business. The loan will help him to start his food shop. He hopes in the future to expand his business. 
Beqir has many plans for his business, but for the time being, only wants to gather enough capital to expand it. He is very happy for the financial support that Kiva lenders gives him, because this way he is certain of making progress in his work. He really appreciates this support!

loans.use: To do renovation, to buy rack and windows

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is a 47-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has four grown-up children. Edwina has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than six years now. Her husband is a fisherman. Edwina is asking for a loan to buy materials for the repair of the boat like plywood, nails, paint and others. 

Edwina hopes that through this loan, they will be able to improve their business thus increasing their profit and income.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of the boat like plywood, nails, paint and others

loans.name: Ismaiil

texts.en:
Ismaiil is a 40-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children who are attending school. With his family’s support, he has been capable of managing the house expenses and living a proper life.  Despite all the difficulties that he has faced, he was brave and not afraid to take on his own all the family responsibilities.  

Ismaiil started to work as a painter in 2007 and still does. He works on a free-lance basis and is considered friendly especially with his loyal customers. He’s expert in his field and knows very well how to deal with his clients. Today, he’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added painting tools for his business in order to be able to handle his new project. This Kiva loan will open a new door for him to take on bigger projects and increase his productivity by 30%. In the future, he plans to open his own painting shop.

loans.use: to purchase added painting tools for his business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all her children are in school. She sells second-hand clothes door – to – door. She takes care of additional family members (her young sisters). She has been in this business for the last three years. She works six days a week. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

Mariam has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 300,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes.   Her aspirations are to get permanent business premises and to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but has no access to piped water. Her major expenses monthly include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Houssam El Dine

texts.en:
Houssam El Dine is 27 years old and single. He has been providing transporting services for six years. He owns a pickup truck which he uses to transport furniture and for many other services depending on customer needs.
Houssam El Dine is applying for his first youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to replace his pickup's wheels so the pickup would be in good shape to respond better to his customers needs.
Houssam El Dine made deals with many furniture-selling showrooms to make sure that he is the one responsible for transporting their customers requests.

loans.use: to replace his pickup's wheels for his transporting business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Sandra Yamileth

texts.es: Sandra, tiene 42 años de edad, casada, tiene 1 hijo y vive en una colonia suburbana de san Pedro Sula.  Sandra estableció  su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende granos básicos, lácteos, embutidos, carnes, huevos, pastas, productos enlatados, pastillas, manteca, azúcar y otros abarrotes. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio anteriormente vendía ropa usada y hace 10 años decidió la venta de productos alimenticios y hasta la fecha le ha ido bien. Actualmente ha decidido por solicitar un préstamo de 22,000 lempiras para comprar más productos alimenticios para surtir la pulpería y con una parte del préstamo va hacer un anexo en su casa para ubicar el negocio, va comprar los materiales como cemento y bloques y su esposo lo construirá, así podrá dar mejor atención a sus clientes. Tiene como meta mantener surtido su negocio para aumentar las ventas y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sandra’s 42-years-old,  married and has a son.  She lives in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  She started her own grocery store business where she sells basic grains, dairy products, canned goods, meats, eggs, pasta, cured meats, pills, lard, sugar and other grocery items.  She’s always been a merchant; she used to sell used clothes and ten years ago decided to go into grocery sales and has done well to date.

She’s currently decided to request a 22,000 Lempira loan to buy more food items to stock her store and will use part of the loan to build an annex onto her house to run the business in.  She will buy supplies like cement and concrete blocks and her husband will build it.  In this way she’ll be able to provide better customer service.  Her goal is to keep her store well-stocked to increase sales and income.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store and to enlarge the store.

loans.name: Georges

texts.en:
Georges is a 51-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married and lives with his wife and three children. Two are working and the other is still studying. He, together with his wife, manages the family’s household expenses while operating his business. Georges has been a detergent wholesaler since 2010. He sells different types of detergents such as floor, window, glass, toilet and home appliance cleaning products. He works from home, where many customers from his community visit him to buy their needed products at good prices. He keeps on working very hard in order to maintain his family’s financial status at a good level. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to expand his product inventory of detergents. He confirms that the loan will help him boost his sales and thus his income by 15%.

loans.use: to expand his product inventory of detergents

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 30-year-old married man and father of two children. He has been working as a butcher for 18 years. In August 2012, he opened his own butcher shop to increase his income and improve his standard of living.
Ahmad is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a freezer necessary for his business. He will also use part of the loan for necessary maintenance on his house.
Ahmad was only 12 years old when he started working to help his family make their living. Today, he is putting forth much effort so his children would not suffer a miserable childhood as he did
This is his fifth loan as an Al Majmoua borrower and he has good standing paying back his loans.
He hopes to keep on expanding his business as much as he can, to better meet his family's needs.

loans.use: To buy a freezer necessary for his business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. They live in Trinidad, Bohol, Philippines. Erlinda is in the farming business. She helps her husband in tilling their farm.
Erlinda works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of their children. Erlinda is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and to pay the school fees of her children. With this, they will be able to improve their farm and eventually their harvest.
In the future, Erlinda hopes to make her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and to pay the school fees of her children

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette is a 47-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has seven children ranging in age from 27 to 12. She is engaged in the fish-vending business. She has been in this business for 25 years. Her husband is a fisherman. She sells fish, sea shells and shrimp to customers in her community. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy a fishnet, fishhooks and floaters. In the future, Bernadette would you like to expand her business to support her family as well as to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a fish net, fishhooks and floaters.

loans.name: Charie

texts.en:
Charie is a married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol, Philippines and the mother of two young children. She has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for several years now. This has been the source of their income.

Charie is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and so on. With this, her husband will be able to catch more, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Charie hopes to make their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and so on.

loans.name: Wafic

texts.en:
Wafic is a 23-year-old, single man who has been selling coffee for five months. He sells espresso coffee to the neighboring shops and replies to customers' special delivery requests.

Wafic is an energetic, hard worker who puts so much effort into improving his living and increasing his income. Wafic applied for a youth loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, in order to buy new computers, to open a special Internet cafe which will go in parallel with his present business, since both businesses can complete each other, as he says. This means that most of the people who will come to use the Internet service might request a hot drink to add joy to their time. In the future, Wafic hopes to keep on expanding both businesses, more and more.

loans.use: to buy computers for his new Internet cafe business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a 49-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has five children. The oldest child is nineteen, while the youngest is six. She is engaged in farming. She has been growing rice for 20 years. In addition to farming, she also operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells canned goods, noodles, soaps and condiments. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fertilizer to gain more harvest. In the future, Cecilia would like to invest in other ventures to support her family as well as to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 49-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and four children. Two of them are working. Sami has owned a fruit and vegetable shop in his town since 1982. He provides his customers with fresh fruits and vegetables to keep on maintaining his good reputation and seeking a wider range of customers. His prices are fair enough and that’s what catches the attention of passing customers. 

Today, he is demanding a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his store’s inventory. He states that the loan will unquestionably help him stock additional merchandise. In that way, he will be able to increase his business sales and therefore his income. Having a big family is a huge responsibility especially for someone like Sami who wishes to offer his wife and children whatever they ask for.

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory

loans.name: Dorina

texts.en: Dorina is a 25-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. Dorina helps her husband, a fisherman, in their business. Dorina needs a loan to buy new fishing nets, screens, lead weights and buckets for storage. With this, her husband will be able to catch more fish thus allowing them to sell more to the market. Dorina hopes of expanding their business and saving money for reinvestment into the business. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, screen, lead weights, buckets for storage

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy lives in Sinkor, an area where the living conditions are similar to those of central Monrovia. She is 40 year old, married, and has two children, ages 3 and 13. For the past four years she has been running a table market where she sells palm oil, rice, pepper, and other items. She started this business by selling plantain chips, with help from her mother. She learned her sales skills from her mother. She likes her business because it gives her more profits and makes her popular. She is requesting a loan to buy more palm oil, rice, pepper, etc. for her business. She wants to earn more money to build a house since she already has a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, rice, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Wenifreda

texts.en:
Wenifreda is a 49-year-old farmer from San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and has five children. She is a farmer and also has a food vending business selling home cooked snack foods to the people in her area.  Her husband works as a carpenter aside from being a farmer. Wenifreda does her best to lend a hand to her husband in meeting the needs of the family especially for the school expenses of their children.
Wenifreda needs a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and ingredients for her food vending business like flour, sugar, and butter. She wants to save money for the schooling of their children. Wenifreda dreams of experiencing fullness of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and ingredients for her food vending business like flour, sugar, and butter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to prepare and sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel  is a 36-year-old married man. He has two children, 3 years and 5 years old. He describes himself to be a hard-working man. He operates a grocery store where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located within a viable business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of vegetable and fruit prices. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fruits and vegetables for resale. His business goal is to run his business in permanent business premises within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruit to sell

loans.name: Yelen

texts.en:
Yelen is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of two children ages eight and six. They live in Bien Unido, Bohol, Philippines. Yelen has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than seven years now. Yelen needs a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and other fishing materials. With a loan, Yelen and her husband will be able to improve their fishing business and augment their income. 

Yelen dreams of expanding their business and making it sustainable so that it will generate more money necessary for the needs of the family especially for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and other fishing materials

loans.name: Saudah

texts.en: Saudah is a resident of Ruti, a suburb of Mbarara municipality. She got married at the young age of 17 and was married until last year when she divorced. She left her marriage with three children who she’s taking care of. Because of such circumstances she was forced to start up a business of a retail shop to enable her to earn a living. This business is developing and giving her income for survival. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to buy more stock and add capital to her small business so as to increase her income as well as improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her shop

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha lives in Montserrado County, Sinkor, Liberia; one of the areas that the living conditions are almost equal to the people who live in the center of Monrovia. She is 40 years old, married and has two children aged 7 and 19.  Her children are attending school, and she has been running a table for the past 19 years where she sells pepper, rice, palm oil, vita, onions, okra, etc. in the local market. The profits from her business are use on food and rent. She started this business with money from her husband.  She spends 8 hours a day on her business, and enjoys the response from her customers. She uses a taxi to get her goods to her table from the wholesale store. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, rice, palm oil, vita, onions, okra, etc. for her business. Her plan is to own a car for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, rice, palm oil, vita, onions, okra, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Dimitri

texts.en:
Dimitri is 44 years old, and lives in the Mtskheta district with his wife and two children (16 and 20). His wife works as a nurse at the hospital, and Dimitri is a worker with a private company that builds bridges. The family is also involved in poultry farming, and owns 15 hens. 

He has decided to start a new business to supplement his income, but he lacks experience with new business start-ups and does not qualify under income requirements. 

Dimitri is requesting a loan under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program envisions providing start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to many credit products, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Dimitri will use his loan to start a car wash. He will purchase essential equipment, and a vacuum cleaner. 

Dimitri will provide services to his local community members, and hopes to increase the monthly income of the family. His new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy the equipment to start a car wash.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Mary Nataana

texts.en: Mary is windowed but has managed to pay her previous loan thanks to a bumper maize harvest. She has now diversified to farming beans and raising livestock. She is requesting a loan for KES. 40,000 from KADET LTD to buy additional cows and goats to fatten and resell. She plans to use the additional profits she earns to pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Margelis

texts.es: Margelis de 44 años de edad se dedica a la venta de refrescos y cervezas al por mayor y al detal, en la comunidad donde, habita al suroccidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla; En sus 4 años de experiencia, ha logrado construir una clientela y ya es muy reconocida , por eso ella requiere tener inventarios permanentes para poder responder efectivamente al mercado. Su negocio fue iniciativa de su cónyuge pues necesitaban genera un nuevo ingreso para lograr aun mayor bienestar en su hogar, él tuvo en cuenta que en su sector no había venta de cervezas y la gente caminaba largos trayectos para perder adquirirlas, así fue como al iniciar su negocio respondió a las necesidades de sus vecinos y con ello ha crecido. En la actualidad de está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor número cervezas, pues se acerca la temporada de carnaval y previo a esta, cada fin de semana, muchas fiestas de disfraces y luces que ameritan el consumo de su clientela. Su horario de trabajo inicia a las 12 del medio día y termina doce horas después. Su meta mas adelante es convertirse en proveedor de todas las unidades de negocios cercanas a su barrio, para generar más ingresos con el fin de que sus hijos logren un mayor nivel educativo y se conviertan en ciudadanos de bien.
texts.en:
Margelis is 44 years old and works selling soft drinks and beer both wholesale and retail in the community where she lives, located to the south west of Barranquilla. During the last four years, she has managed build up a customer base and now she is very well-known. For this reason, she needs to be able to have a permanent inventory to be able to respond to the market effectively. Starting the business was her husband’s idea, because they needed to generate a new source of income to be more comfortable at home. He saw that there was no one selling beer in their area, and people walked for a long way to get it. That’s why they decided to start the business to respond to the needs of their neighbors. 

She is currently requesting a Kiva loan, which is her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy beer at wholesale. The carnival season is coming up and, prior to this, every weekend there are many fancy dress parties and festivals of light which increase customers’ consumption. Her working day is from 12 p.m. to 12 a.m. Her goal is to become the supplier of all the businesses near to her area in order to generate more income and give her children a better education, so that they grow to become good citizens.

loans.use: to buy beer at wholesale for her business.

loans.name: Luis Rafael

texts.es: Luis, tiene 34 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. El tiene 5 años de dedicarse a la compra y venta de plantas ornamentales de todo tipo. Anteriormente el se dedicaba a la venta de frutas y verduras. Estas plantas las vende en forma ambulante utilizando su vehículo para ofrecer de casa en casa y viajar a varios lugares para vender. Actualmente solicita un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para surtir de plantas y atender la demanda de los clientes. Su meta es ampliar la ruta de ventas en otros lugares y mantener inventario.
texts.en:
Luis is 34 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives in the town of Santa Cruz de Yojoa.  

Luis has been buying and selling all types of ornamental plants for five years.  He previously sold fruits and vegetables.  Luis sells these plants as a traveling vendor, using his vehicle to go house to house.  He travels to several different places in order to conduct sales.  

Luis is currently requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL so that he can restock with plants and meet the demand from his customers.  His goals are to expand his sales route to other places and to maintain his inventory.

loans.use: to buy ornamental plants to sell.

loans.name: Edmund

texts.en:
Edmund is an old man of 61 from Kashongi, a village in  the Kiruhura district. He is  respectfully referred to as "Mzee", a word that means old man. 

He is married to four wives, and each wife has six children. Out of the 24 children, 20 are in school. In the photograph is Edmund and one of his wives.

He is also the best farmer in his village, with good agricultural-income-generating projects ranging from coffee farming, banana farming, pig and goat rearing. This has enabled him to take care of his big family, pay school fees for the children, build houses to accommodate them, and provide other basics. 

He requested for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to help him pay part of the school fees; this loan will be paid back using proceeds from his farm.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 32 years old and married with four children; his spouse runs a grocery business which helps in producing some additional income. Thomas runs a timber yard, as well as hires out his power saw in Baringo County.  He has been in business for four years, and his monthly income from the business is KES. 12,000.
 
He has requested a loan of KES. 40,000, which he intends to use to purchase more timber for sale. He plans to use the additional income to plow back into the business, and to educate his children.

He dream is to expand his business and create a big sawmill/timber yard.

loans.use: To purchase timber for his timber business.

loans.name: Hevar's Group

texts.en:
Hevar is the leader of Hevar's Group. Hevar is a young, Iraqi woman. She is 21 years old, married, and a mother of one child. With limited career options, due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Hevar is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Hevar has two years' experience with the small, home-based, sewing business activity which she hopes to improve, to increase her ability to offer more choices for her customers. She has many creative ideas for working on her orders of dresses and other small, fabric, household items. To be able to implement more of these ideas, she would like to buy an over machine. A small portion of the group's loan will allow Hevar to make the purchase.  


Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor and, therefore, unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy an over machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina is widowed and the mother of five children, three of whom go to school. She earns a living by running a pub, has been in this business for eight years and sells to all kinds of people.  She has applied for a loan for 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of beer, soda, gin and mineral water. She generates additional income by selling charcoal and works seven days a week. Her major business challenges are transportation and people who do not pay their bills. She hopes to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house because she now lives in a home that she rents. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.
